Position may also assist other staff and provide non-administrative backup for supervisor as necessary.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Handles counter issues and distribution of warehouse items in accordance with Warehouse Policies &amp; Procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Unloads &amp; loads vendor, freight &amp; company vehicles using material handling equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Receives incoming stock materials into the warehouse, performs a logistics inspection, stocks shelves, and ships outgoing materials.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs material receipt, issue &amp; warehouse functions in SAP, within established Roles and Responsibility guidelines.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>If assigned the MRP process, duties include, monitors SAP inventory levels for re-ordering, purchasing, repairing or replacement of stock items within the limits of established SAP Roles and Responsibilities. (When assigned this SAP role, position cannot receipt inventory, but can perform the issuing function)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures compliance with Sarbanes Oxley process and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides support as necessary to Refinery Operations, Maintenance, Turnaround, Capital, Strategic Sourcing, Accounting, Contractors, Vendors, and other business partners.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains PC based spread sheets in support of internal warehouse logs, reports, etc.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interfaces with non-inventory items such as chemicals, catalyst, lube oils, and directs charge material – load, store, receive, monitor, etc.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists plant personnel in entering materials requirement data into SAP system as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs physical inventory cycle counts as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors inventory levels and initiates material reorder requests.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Adheres to all safety rules and procedures as established by the Company.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cleans and maintains a safe work environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried nonexempt status, which means you are eligible <div>\n  Craftperson A - Electrician -22001SL\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Repairs, maintains, and installs electrical systems and equipment following all safety procedures, electrical codes, manuals, schematic drawings, diagrams, and blueprints.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates knowledge of basic grounding and shielding, electricity, and electrical wiring and raceway systems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains and repairs various types of electrical components.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uses test equipment, measuring, and alignment tools to perform assigned work tasks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Plans and coordinates work following appropriate work orders, work permits, and safety instructions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs work activities in a safe and environmentally sound manner.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The hourly rate for this position is $50.85 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     A minimum of 5 years related electrical experience is required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Associate degree or technical degree in an electrical field preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Wilmington Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>The Valero Wilmington Refinery was commissioned in 1969 and has had three major expansions to become a fully integrated refinery and several upgrades to meet clean-fuel standards. The Wilmington refinery processes a blend of California and foreign crude oil, as well as unfinished feedstocks from local and foreign sources. Given its coking and desulfurizing capabilities, it is particularly well-suited to process lower-cost heavy, high-sulfur crude oils and feedstocks. The refinery also produces 15 percent of the asphalt supply in southern California. Refined products are distributed from the Wilmington refinery through a network of third-party pipelines and terminals in southern California, Nevada and Arizona, and then on to wholesale and retail customers.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  Craftperson A - Rotating Equipment-22001SO\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Installs, inspects, and maintains rotating equipment within the refinery.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Inspects, troubleshoots and performs maintenance on rotating equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Adjusts and aligns machinery and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uses hand and power tools to complete assigned work tasks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reads and interprets schematics and drawings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Is able to set-up, prepare, and inspect the work site.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates knowledge of basic physical and mechanical principles and craft math.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understands bearings, seals, compressors, pumps and cylinders, valve and pipe configurations, shaft packing, and drive systems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understands characteristics of metals and is knowledgeable about the various types and applications of lubricants.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows guidelines and procedures to ensure that rotating equipment is working in a safe and reliable manner.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The hourly rate for this position is $50.85 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     A minimum of 5 years of Rotating Equipment or related experience, which could include experience as a machinist, millwright, or pump mechanic required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fp> \n  <p> All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Wilmington Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>The Valero Wilmington Refinery was commissioned in 1969 and has had three major expansions to become a fully integrated refinery and several upgrades to meet clean-fuel standards. The Wilmington refinery processes a blend of California and foreign crude oil, as well as unfinished feedstocks from local and foreign sources. Given its coking and desulfurizing capabilities, it is particularly well-suited to process lower-cost heavy, high-sulfur crude oils and feedstocks. The refinery also produces 15 percent of the asphalt supply in southern California. Refined products are distributed from the Wilmington refinery through a network of third-party pipelines and terminals in southern California, Nevada and Arizona, and then on to wholesale and retail customers.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  Pipefitter - Experienced-230010T\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Installs and maintains process pipe and piping systems within the refinery through the application of appropriate welding techniques.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Selects, installs, and removes various pipe, and piping systems, fittings, gaskets, tubing, and valves.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Repairs and replaces flanges and performs maintenance on leaking pipes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows safety and work permits to tie into existing lines, vessels, or tanks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uses hand and power tools to complete assigned work tasks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uses precision measuring and alignment tools to ensure proper alignment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates the ability to read and interpret basic schematics, blueprints, and drawings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows guidelines and procedures to ensure that equipment is working in a safe and reliable manner.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> related pipefitter experience is required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. shaft packing, and drive systems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understands characteristics of metals and is knowledgeable about the various types and applications of lubricants.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows guidelines and procedures to ensure that rotating equipment is working in a safe and reliable manner.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are <div>\n  Boiler Operator I - Ethanol Plant - Bloomingburg-22001QV\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Oversees the daily operation of an assigned area of the production process within the plant. Working a 12-hour rotating shift schedule while maintaining a safe work environment. Monitors and maintains production quality and equipment, while supporting the policies, goals, and objectives of the Company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Monitors and controls plant operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews the operation of the plant constantly to monitor production and quality, anticipating and solving problems in a timely manner, and identifying opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in projects that improve efficiency and\u002For reduce operating costs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Documents and monitors process variables, sample data and routine tasks as required for postion, to ensure plant operations are maintained within operating parameters.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Quality Assurance\u002FQuality Control program, interprets results, and takes appropriate action when required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates with all departments within the facility to ensure safe and efficient execution of daily plant activites.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors and troubleshoot process issues and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs scheduled Operations Work Requests as requested by Supervisor or Plant Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares equipment to ensure it is safe for maintenance\u002Fcontractors to perform scheduled work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Utilizes company safe work practices to ensure all work is performed safely.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in programs and procedures required to ensure plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors use and inventories of process chemicals and supplies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned to maintain a safe, reliable, and consistent operation.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     An Ohio High Pressure Boiler Operator license required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Bloomingburg<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> Valero's Bloomingburg ethanol plant is located near Bloomingburg, Ohio, about 40 miles southwest of Columbus. The bio-refinery sits on approximately 65 acres and started ethanol production in March 2008. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Bloomingburg plant annually processes approximately 47 million bushels of corn into approximately 135 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 355,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 60 employees. Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com. \n   <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n   <ul>\n <div>\n  Shipping &amp; Receiving Operator - Ethanol Plant-22001T4\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Responsible for unloading raw materials and loading ethanol and distiller’s grain, work 12-hour rotating day shifts, as well as the movement of trucks and rails cars on the plant site. Ensure maximum production quantity and quality while supporting the policies, goals and objectives of the company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operates and maintains all processes associated with corn receiving, corn storage, product storage, unloading, and loading.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Unloads corn from trucks and railcars.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Loads ethanol into trucks and railcars.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Loads distiller’s grains into trucks, railcars, and containers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Takes samples of corn, ethanol, and distiller’s grains for testing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates plant scale house; probes, analyzes, and grades corn, weighs trucks in and out, enters data into scale house software, issues paperwork to drivers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates meters and bulk weighers to facilitate product loading.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates locomotive or rail mover to move railcars on plant site to facilitate loading and unloading of product.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates large machinery and equipment such as front end loaders and lifts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs. (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs preventive maintenance tasks as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs routine housekeeping duties to maintain a clean work environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors area equipment and assists with maintenance as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates regularly with local rail service to facilitate rail movement activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with the movement and loading of rail cars preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience working with heavy equipment in an industrial environment or grain elevator preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with the operation of front-end loaders, forklift trucks, rail movers, man lifts, and related material handling equipment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with standard computer software programs, i.e. Microsoft Outlook and SAP, preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Mount Vernon<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Mount Vernon ethanol plant is located in Mount Vernon, Indiana, in the far southwestern corner of the state on the Ohio River, the boundary with Kentucky. Part of the Evansville, Indiana, metropolitan area, Mount Vernon is approximately 190 miles southwest of Indianapolis. The bio-refinery sits on 112 acres leased from the Ports of Indiana, and started ethanol production in December 2010. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Mount Vernon plant processes approximately 35 million bushels of corn into approximately 100 million gallons of ethanol and 2630,000 tons of distillers grains per year. The plant employs approximately 60 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Process Operator - Mount Vernon Ethanol Plant-22001S3\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Oversees the daily operation of an assigned area of the production process within the plant. Working a 12-hour rotating shift schedule while maintaining a safe work environment. Monitors and maintains production quality and equipment, while supporting the policies, goals, and objectives of the Company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Monitors and controls plant operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews the operation of the plant constantly to monitor production and quality, anticipating and solving problems in a timely manner, and identifying opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in projects that improve efficiency and\u002For reduce operating costs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Documents and monitors process variables, sample data and routine tasks as required for position, to ensure plant operations are maintained within operating parameters.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Quality Assurance\u002FQuality Control program, interprets results, and takes appropriate action when required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates with all departments within the facility to ensure safe and efficient execution of daily plant activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors and troubleshoot process issues and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs scheduled Operations Work Requests as requested by Supervisor or Plant Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares equipment to ensure it is safe for maintenance\u002Fcontractors to perform scheduled work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Utilizes company safe work practices to ensure all work is performed safely.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in programs and procedures required to ensure plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors use and inventories of process chemicals and supplies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned to maintain a safe, reliable, and consistent operation.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p>Please click on the following link to view what the Process Operator job involves on a day to day basis: <b>Realistic Job Preview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Associate Degree in Process Technology or equivalent preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Mount Vernon<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Mount Vernon ethanol plant is located in Mount Vernon, Indiana, in the far southwestern corner of the state on the Ohio River, the boundary with Kentucky. Part of the Evansville, Indiana, metropolitan area, Mount Vernon is approximately 190 miles southwest of Indianapolis. The bio-refinery sits on 112 acres leased from the Ports of Indiana, and started ethanol production in December 2010. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Mount Vernon plant processes approximately 35 million bushels of corn into approximately 100 million gallons of ethanol and 2630,000 tons of distillers grains per year. The plant employs approximately 60 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Supervisor Operations-22001R2\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Supervises and directs the daily operations of an assigned area and leads a team of unit operators to ensure safe, efficient and reliable operations in order to optimize all plant economic planning, production and HS&amp;E objectives.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Supervises and directs the daily and long-range operation activities of a unit, to include reviewing, writing &amp; prioritizing daily and permanent work orders.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews refinery safety and environmental practices and procedures, and safety and environmental hazards of the process materials, chemicals and catalysts in assigned area with operating crews on specific jobs, on shutdown and start-up procedures, and on unusual operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures the safety of all personnel by enforcing safety expectations and encouraging compliance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures operators prepare equipment correctly and safely for maintenance, following all relevant procedures and policies. This includes work permitting and confined space entry procedures and addresses all safety issues as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Inspects the plant with operators to maintain housekeeping standards. Ensures through the operators that clean-up is done after maintenance work, and that conditions that could lead to housekeeping problems are corrected.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains inventories and monitors usage of operating supplies, consumable safety supplies and miscellaneous supplies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates and collaborates with all refinery departments, including other Unit Superintendents, to meet operational objectives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors plant performance to maximize capabilities and efficiency and continually seeks for opportunities of improvement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in setting objectives in turnaround and shutdown planning; generates work lists, blind lists, etc.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates daily maintenance and maintains operational files for logs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates extensively in managing and implementing PSM, MOCA, and HAZOP guidelines and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures compliance with PSM which includes writing First Reports of incidents, participating in and leading incident investigations and Hazop studies, and both writing and editing operating manuals procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Troubleshoots\u002Fsolves unit operational and maintenance problems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors employee situations, which require knowledge of Company policies and procedures and addresses any performance issues as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collaborates with Operators in implementing team management style, and all other aspects of supervisor employee relations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews operational data and lab analysis daily and cooperates with Laboratory, Pumping and Product Control personnel to ensure product quality and the disposition of products and the availability of modified asphalts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and provides necessary operator training in operations and safety with the assistance of the Training and Safety Departments and ensures operators remain compliant with all mandatory training.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with the Environmental Department as required to maintain all environmental regulations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures environmental compliance, including surveillance and evaluation of Computerized Emissions Monitoring Systems (CEMS).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Attends daily Complex meeting and communicates to operating personnel daily guidelines orally and written to maintain effective and efficient operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs special projects and other duties as assigned.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of refinery operations experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>8 years of overall experience in a refinery preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. <div>\n  Staff Safety Engineer-22001N1\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Understands State and Federal safety regulations, assesses and communicates the implications of those regulations to Operations, and works with Operations to develop and implement cost-effective compliance solutions. Works with Regional and other Safety Engineers to develop and implement Best Practices solutions to common safety regulations and issues.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Develops and maintains the expert knowledge of the regulations and requirements applicable to the site.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Acts as site expert for specific regulations in their assigned field. Maintains awareness of all new and changing federal and state regulations and is informed of their timing and potential impact.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and maintains a good understanding of the units and processes to which the regulations and requirements must be applied.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides technical support to the Process Safety Management (PSM) and Emergency Response (ER) functions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Facilitates the writing or writes site safety procedures and helps refinery functional groups implement those procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reduces safety costs through the implementation of best practices at the site.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with ER function to develop effective procedures and plans for responding to refinery emergencies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates capital projects for process changes and use of new chemicals for safety impact and compliance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and implements cost effective compliance solutions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and maintains good communication, presentation and interpersonal skills that help Operations and other functional groups implement those process changes or procedures necessary to comply with the regulations and requirements. Is responsive to routine requests for Information from Operations and other functional groups. Facilitates the writing or writes site safety procedures and helps Operations and other functional groups translate requirements into written procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates an untiring effort to find new and better ways to comply with new and existing regulations and requirements that reduce the burden on Operations and other functional groups.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops training materials pertaining to safety issues as required by the site due to new or changing Federal or State regulations. Provides the training materials to the parties responsible for delivering site training or may deliver the training directly to the site employees.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains records to demonstrate compliance: reviews plant modifications for safety systems and supporting documentation to illustrate compliance to the regulations and VPP Star requirements with confidence and ease. Interacts with agency inspectors in a manner that minimizes negative impacts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops the confidence, capability, and willingness to maintain the site's position with an agency representative, as appropriate, on the interpretation and applicability of a regulation or requirement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Trade Association (e.g. Tcc, VPPPA, and ASSE) meetings for their assigned field. Networks with other company representatives to gain information on compliance strategies and ideas for compliance alternatives and shares this information with the site and across Equistar manufacturing as appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with their supervisor on professional and personal development and career planning.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reduces safety costs through the implementation of Best Practices at the site.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with the region and other site safety organizations on consolidated contracts which add value to the organization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports opportunity projects (eg. ERT training requirements, etc.) in the most cost-effective manner.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with Operations and the regional organization to maintain compliance so that unwarranted agency inspections do not occur. Develops a business-oriented behavior for implementing regulatory requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and maintains a working knowledge of the site and processes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with Operations and the regional organization to implement processes to meet regulatory requirements and ensure operating flexibility.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates process changes for safety impact or compliance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates new chemicals for safety impact or compliance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Possesses signature authority to issue releases against standing purchasing orders at the discretion of the Site HSE Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The salary range for this position is $130,400 to $179,300 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor's or higher level degree in Engineering or a related Science required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>8 years of safety experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience representing a company to the regulatory agencies required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>CA Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH) preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Benicia Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero acquired the Benicia Refinery in 2000. Built as a grass-roots project in 1968, this plant has undergone significant modifications and upgrades to become what it is today one of the most complex refineries in the United States. Approximately 70 percent of the refinery’s product slate is California Air Resources Board (CARB) gasoline, California’s clean-burning fuel. The refinery also has significant asphalt production capabilities and produces 35 percent of the asphalt supply in northern California. Currently, the refinery processes domestic crude from the San Joaquin Valley in California and the Alaska North Slope, along with foreign sour crudes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Sr. Metallurgist-220010Y\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Provides technical support for metallurgy, material selection, and corrosion engineering to enable the most reliable performance that will meet the company’s economic, environmental and safety objectives.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provides metallurgical, materials, welding and engineering support for refinery operating units.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Leads the Damage Mechanism Review (DMR) of process units and recommendations from DMR to comply with California State and regulatory requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides damage mechanism reviews and corrosion expertise to a multi-disciplinary Risk Based Inspection (RBI) team and recommend corrosion mitigation strategy including metallurgy upgrade, process control, corrosion monitoring and inspection and provide technical support for implementing the recommended corrosion mitigation strategy.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manages the site’s special emphasis programs (HTHA, wash water, critical heat exchangers, welding on equipment in service, Benicia Refinery Practices (BRPs), etc.) for refinery fixed equipment and piping system.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Areas of operations support include metallurgy, process corrosion monitoring, process corrosion control and mitigation, opportunity crude evaluation, primary contact for refinery corrosion control vendors, project and maintenance materials selection, etc.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports capital projects in areas of materials selection and equipment degradation control methodologies (e.g., corrosion probes, wash water, sample points, equipment degradation documents).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports turnaround organizations in piping\u002Fequipment degradation identification and use of risk-based methodology.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Leads failure analyses and participate in incident investigations related to fixed equipment to prevent recurrence of similar failures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Implements best practices for common problem areas, maintenance of refinery materials and corrosion control documents, and staying abreast of emerging technologies and current materials related activities in refining industry organizations (NACE, API, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The salary range for this position is $117,600 to $161,700 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Metallurgical Engineering, Materials Engineering, Corrosion Engineering, or Welding Engineering required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of experience in refinery related positions with exposure and responsibilities in the maintenance area, including rotating equipment, vibration analysis, instrument and electrical fundamentals, and fixed equipment inspections required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Benicia Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero acquired the Benicia Refinery in 2000. Built as a grass-roots project in 1968, this plant has undergone significant modifications and upgrades to become what it is today one of the most complex refineries in the United States. Approximately 70 percent of the refinery’s product slate is California Air Resources Board (CARB) gasoline, California’s clean-burning fuel. The refinery also has significant asphalt production capabilities and produces 35 percent of the asphalt supply in northern California. Currently, the refinery processes domestic crude from the San Joaquin Valley in California and the Alaska North Slope, along with foreign sour crudes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status including sexual orientation, gender identity, Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites. Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n <div>\n  Process Operator - Linden Ethanol Plant-22001S5\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Oversees the daily operation of an assigned area of the production process within the plant. Working a 12-hour rotating shift schedule while maintaining a safe work environment. Monitors and maintains production quality and equipment, while supporting the policies, goals, and objectives of the Company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Monitors and controls plant operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews the operation of the plant constantly to monitor production and quality, anticipating and solving problems in a timely manner, and identifying opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in projects that improve efficiency and\u002For reduce operating costs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Documents and monitors process variables, sample data and routine tasks as required for position, to ensure plant operations are maintained within operating parameters.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Quality Assurance\u002FQuality Control program, interprets results, and takes appropriate action when required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates with all departments within the facility to ensure safe and efficient execution of daily plant activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors and troubleshoot process issues and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs scheduled Operations Work Requests as requested by Supervisor or Plant Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares equipment to ensure it is safe for maintenance\u002Fcontractors to perform scheduled work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Utilizes company safe work practices to ensure all work is performed safely.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in programs and procedures required to ensure plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors use and inventories of process chemicals and supplies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned to maintain a safe, reliable, and consistent operation.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p>Please click on the following link to view what the Process Operator job involves on a day to day basis: <b>Realistic Job Preview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Associate Degree in Process Technology or equivalent preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Linden<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Linden ethanol plant is located near Linden, Indiana, about 60 miles northwest of Indianapolis. The bio-refinery sits on approximately 80 acres and started ethanol production in August 2007. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Linden plant annually processes approximately 47 million bushels of corn into 135 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 355,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 60 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Loss Control Manager-22001QT\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero Energy is looking for a <b>Loss Control Manage<\u002Fb>r to join our team at the <b>San Antonio Headquarters<\u002Fb>. The Loss Control Manager manages a Loss Control aspect at specified refinery and refinery associated distribution systems. Within a specified geographic region, the Loss Control Manager provides Loss Control support to Valero terminals and associated distribution systems. Loss Control aspects to include proactive activities to ensure quality and quantity of feedstock and product volumes. The Loss Control Manager utilizes best practice to protect Valero’s interest in all aspects of volume movements and reduction of vessel demurrage. The Loss Control Manager provides immediate resolution of measurement deficiencies to prevent potential claims. Daily activities may include:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Evaluates and reviews industry developments in the aspects of measuring and transporting petroleum to minimize the Company's exposure to volume losses, measurement claims, and excess demurrage.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interprets company policies to employees and enforces safety regulations. Evaluates and assigns employee roles and responsibilities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and implements strategies to motivate employees toward achievement of group initiatives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Selects, directs, and audits petroleum inspection companies to ensure competent services are conducted according to the Valero “Inspector Services Agreement”.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with refinery groups on aspects of maintenance, scheduling, and design of equipment which affects custody transfers and custody measurements. Recommends and initiates procedures related to custody transfers which meet initiatives of Valero and industry best practice.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiates and resolves quantity or quality claims by direct communication with industry counterparts<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews documentation of custody transfers for purposes of claim initiation\u002Fmitigation, demurrage claims, and measurement requirements of government and local agencies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Keeps up to date on industry changes by attending various seminars and training courses.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures that metering systems in area(s) of responsibility are proven, witnessed and calibrated on the required frequency and that discrepancies are communicated promptly.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Witnesses custody meter proving and meter prover calibrations. Initiate\u002Fimplement actions to ensure proper meter factors are determined and properly applied in the final calculation of volumes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiates record and reports departmental cost savings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Must be able to travel up to 35% of time domestically and\u002For internationally as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Must be able to supervise employees on a daily basis in accordance with company policy, manage performance of direct reports and address any concerns in a timely manner, appropriately engage and develop direct reports, demonstrate leadership.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Moderate Work: Work involves sitting, standing, and\u002For moving from one location to another. Typically includes exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and\u002For up to 20 pounds of force frequently. Might include ability to climb, balance, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl at differing elevations.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High School diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Engineering, Marine or Chemistry discipline preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>10 years of experience working with oil movements, terminal, and\u002For marine operation required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of direct experience and exposure in the field and office to all phases of product transfers and claims required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of supervisory or managerial experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Previous work experience with inspection companies preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Shipping &amp; Receiving Operator - Ethanol Plant-22001IF\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Responsible for unloading raw materials and loading ethanol and distiller’s grain, work 12-hour rotating day shifts, as well as the movement of trucks and rails cars on the plant site. Ensures maximum production quantity and quality while supporting the policies, goals and objectives of the company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operates and maintains all processes associated with corn receiving, corn storage, product storage, unloading, and loading.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Unloads corn from trucks and railcars.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Loads ethanol into trucks and railcars.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Loads distiller’s grains into trucks, railcars, and containers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Takes samples of corn, ethanol, and distiller’s grains for testing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates plant scale house; probes, analyzes, and grades corn, weighs trucks in and out, enters data into scale house software, issues paperwork to drivers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates meters and bulk weighers to facilitate product loading.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates locomotive or rail mover to move railcars on plant site to facilitate loading and unloading of product.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates large machinery and equipment such as front end loaders and lifts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs. (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs preventive maintenance tasks as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs routine housekeeping duties to maintain a clean work environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors area equipment and assists with maintenance as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates regularly with local rail service to facilitate rail movement activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with the movement and loading of rail cars preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience working with heavy equipment in an industrial environment or grain elevator preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with the operation of front-end loaders, forklift trucks, rail movers, man lifts, and related material handling equipment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with standard computer software programs, i.e. Microsoft Outlook and SAP, preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Lakota<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Lakota ethanol plant is located in Lakota, Iowa, about 30 miles southeast of Fairmont, Minnesota. The bio-refinery sits on 78 acres and started ethanol production in November 2002. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Lakota plant annually processes nearly 39 million bushels of corn into 110 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 400,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery has a nameplate capacity of 85 million gallons of ethanol per year and employs approximately 60 full-time personnel.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status including sexual orientation, gender identity, Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans.\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>LI-LP1<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Job:<\u002Fb> vendor correspondence, and acting as liaison between Valero’s vendors and the Accounts Payable department.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides timely and accurate response to internal and external customers to include vendor inquiries via phone and email.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs vendor account analysis and provides ad hoc reports regarding account status in SAP.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Researches vendor issues and submits supporting documentation for timely resolution (e.g., research invoice entry and payment issues).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs root cause analysis for the recommendation of process improvements and the development of procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Facilitates follow-up meetings with department staff to ensure timely resolution of outstanding vendor issues.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures management is updated on recurring vendor issues and suggests appropriate course of action.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducts and coordinates vendor statement research.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uses questioning and listening skills that support effective communication.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Invoices validation and processing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n <div>\n  TRACK Administrator-22001QK\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Assists with the effective operation of the TRACK system based on established processes\u002Fprocedures. Supports and assists other departments and timekeepers using the TRACK system on a daily basis.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Sets up and maintain vendor logs in the TRACK system within established procedures<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with assigning agreed upon schedules and pay formulas to each contract employee in TRACK and verifies accurate pay rates.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with generating contractor workforce schedules, including shifts and days onsite.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Allocates billable hours for each contractor to one or more charge-to codes based on corporate and plant standards.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Downloads information into SAP when allocations are completed and approved on contractors.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews timesheets and work schedules, and enters time worked for each contractor into the TRACK system based on established processes\u002Fprocedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs verification of invoices against the TRACK System and assists with resolving discrepancies based on set procedures in a timely manner.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with extracting and loading allocated costs from TRACK to SAP.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with coordination of contractor work performed as recorded in TRACK with Purchasing, Accounting, Contract Timekeepers, and Security in a timely manner.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with generating contractor man-hour and reconciliation reports for contractor acceptance and invoice support.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with generating workforce reports and exception reports for management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Overrides TRACK time calculations and\u002For correct activity and schedule exceptions as required based on established process for exceptions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists supplier timekeepers and other departments in performing their job functions on the TRACK System.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with system upgrades.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Other duties as assigned<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The rate for this position is $44,000 to $60,500 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of experience in accounts payable, refinery maintenance, or capital expenditure administration required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience using Microsoft Office database and spreadsheet applications (Access and Excel) required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience using TRACK System preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Benicia Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero acquired the Benicia Refinery in 2000. Built as a grass-roots project in 1968, this plant has undergone significant modifications and upgrades to become what it is today one of the most complex refineries in the United States. Approximately 70 percent of the refinery’s product slate is California Air Resources Board (CARB) gasoline, California’s clean-burning fuel. The refinery also has significant asphalt production capabilities and produces 35 percent of the asphalt supply in northern California. Currently, the refinery processes domestic crude from the San Joaquin Valley in California and the Alaska North Slope, along with foreign sour crudes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Process Operator - Albion Ethanol Plant-2300100\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n   <p> Oversees the daily operation of an assigned area of the production process within the plant. Working a 12-hour rotating shift schedule while maintaining a safe work environment. Monitors and maintains production quality and equipment, while supporting the policies, goals, and objectives of the Company.<\u002Fp> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Monitors and controls plant operations.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Reviews the operation of the plant constantly to monitor production and quality, anticipating and solving problems in a timely manner, and identifying opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Participates in projects that improve efficiency and\u002For reduce operating costs.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Documents and monitors process variables, sample data and routine tasks as required for position, to ensure plant operations are maintained within operating parameters.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Participates in Quality Assurance\u002FQuality Control program, interprets results, and takes appropriate action when required.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Communicates with all departments within the facility to ensure safe and efficient execution of daily plant activities.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Monitors and troubleshoot process issues and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Performs scheduled Operations Work Requests as requested by Supervisor or Plant Management.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Prepares equipment to ensure it is safe for maintenance\u002Fcontractors to perform scheduled work.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Utilizes company safe work practices to ensure all work is performed safely.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Participates in programs and procedures required to ensure plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Monitors use and inventories of process chemicals and supplies.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Performs other duties as assigned to maintain a safe, reliable, and consistent operation.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful>\n   <div>\n    This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n   <p>Please click on the following link to view what the Process Operator job involves on a day to day basis: <b>Realistic Job Preview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b>Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Associate Degree in Process Technology or equivalent preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Albion<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Albion ethanol plant is located near Albion, Nebraska, about 50 miles southwest of Norfolk. The bio-refinery sits on 107 acres and started ethanol production in October 2007. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Albion plant annually processes approximately 47 million bushels of corn into approximately 135 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 355,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 60 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n <div>\n  Electrical Engineer-22001JK\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Provides support in the total planning and execution of refinery electrical capital and maintenance projects, provides electrical assistance to Maintenance Department and Operations Departments, and develops Electrical System Reliability programs and procedures that ensure the Refinery is operating at maximum efficiency and reliability.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides technical assistance to the refinery on routine daily electrical issues, including providing troubleshooting assistance to the Electricians, making recommendations to the refinery on field repairs, interpretation of Electrical data gathered during Preventative Maintenance Work orders, and consultations with Design Engineering on electrical design packages.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Operations and Maintenance Departments during Electrical System Disturbances.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Creates and updates electrical drawings such as one-line diagrams, motor schematics, panel schedules, and other related drawings as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares and submit Management of Change (MOC) documentation related to electrical systems and projects and champion the change process through to Pre-Startup Safety Review, Startup of the change and Closeout of the MOC.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and stewards electrical system reliability improvement opportunities, including participation in development and execution of a strategy to improve plant electrical reliability. This strategy involves capital improvement, preventive maintenance, repair strategies, etc<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Updates and maintains SKM electrical system model as electrical system additions and changes occur.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares Refinery short circuit studies, load flow studies, arc flash studies, and motor starting studies as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares high voltage switching procedures. Coordinate and oversee the execution of these procedures by Operations or Maintenance personnel.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proposes amendments to Electrical Safety Policy as necessary to address latest codes and technology.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Makes decisions independently on engineering problems and methods, and represents the organization in meetings to resolve important questions and to plan and coordinate work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides functional and final checkouts of new and modified Electrical System Installations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Serves as co-ESARN representative for Valero-Memphis in monthly phone meetings and yearly face to face meetings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in incident investigations and assists in generating incident reports or failure analyses for incidents involving electrical system disturbances and electrical equipment failures.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Electrical Engineering is required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>2 years of electrical engineering experience in an industrial plant required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in refining or petrochemical environment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with electrical distribution systems, large project execution both engineering and field construction, protective relay coordination, application and testing, and hazardous area classifications preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with induction and synchronous motors and distribution transformers preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team.
