<div>\n  Data Center Engineering Specialist-22001PX\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want to go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the people in the communities where we live and work.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As a <b>Data Center Engineering Specialist<\u002Fb>, you will, under minimal supervision, provide engineering design and support for electrical systems, Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems, fire suppression systems, security systems and other facility aspects of computer data centers. Provide support for enterprise information system infrastructure technology solutions aligned with industry and company standards. Works in close collaboration with team members, end users, and other IS departments to meet the company's goals. The primary focus will be support work, but will also be involved in the design and implementation of projects.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Key Competencies<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Problem Solving<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiative<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Results Orientation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpersonal Skills<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Responsibilities:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Primary focus is to support assigned information system infrastructure disciplines\u002Fcomponents and business users as well as moderately complex enhancements to existing architecture. This includes the use of Valero's system to track support activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides design specifications and procedures for electrical systems, Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems, fire suppression systems, security systems and other facility aspects of the data center facilities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides management, monitoring, and optimization of power utilization, HVAC requirements and capacity planning for data center facilities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides supervision in the use of electrical devices and energy consumption to maintain efficient and safe utilization of Valero data center facilities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates the acquisition, location selection, and power requirements for the installation of new data systems with IS staff.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates retirement, removal, and disposal of computer systems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors and reports on critical power systems (UPSs &amp; PDUs), HVAC systems, fire suppression systems, and leak detection systems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in information system infrastructure design and implementation projects as a project manager, lead or individual contributor, as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works on moderately complex tasks for the design, development, maintenance and upgrade of information system infrastructure involving hardware, software, and system applications. This includes, but is not limited to: trouble-shooting, problem-solving, issue resolution, user interaction, training, defining systems scope, gathering requirements, documenting design specifications, research and fact-finding, configuration, testing, reporting, cutover, IS and business user coordination.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Effective work relationships within departmental and functional lines at various job levels with business users, IS departments and Valero business partners.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Learns or demonstrates an in-depth understanding of more than one information system infrastructure discipline\u002Fcomponent and associated application\u002Fhardware integration.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Helps coordinate the adoption of new procedures resulting from software and hardware changes, including the development of system specifications, documentation, training, and communication plans.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs analysis on and recommends quality complex solutions to information system infrastructure technology disciplines\u002Fcomponents.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understand and applies the various IT methodologies which include project management, development, service management and system architecture.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>May be required to work off-hours and on weekends for projects and\u002For support.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Some travel may be required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>On call 24 x 7 rotations, after hours, and extended hours may be required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Minimum Requirements:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Electrical Engineering, or related field, or equivalent required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of experience with electrical control equipment, electrical circuitry, and data center management or related is required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Sound grounding and experience in electrical engineering principles and analysis required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Preferred Requirements:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Professional standing; possesses or working toward P.E. license preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Membership in IEEE preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Refinery industry or related business\u002FIT experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Benefits<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding? Take a look at some of our best-in-class benefits:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Competitive Pay and Annual Bonus Program<\u002Fli> \n   <li>100% match on 401(K) up to 7%, with immediate vesting<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Company-sponsored Pension Plan<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Comprehensive Healthcare and Wellness Programs<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Daycare Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Employee &amp; Family Wellness Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>State-of-the-art 24-hour Fitness Center free for employees and spouses with access to Tennis and Basketball Facilities<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite cafeteria open for breakfast and lunch<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Sprawling campus with walking paths and access to biking\u002Fhiking on the greenbelt<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>The above description reflects the primary job function and may not include all detailed job functions performed in the role.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Mechanic II (Millwright II)-22001T2\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Position is responsible to perform repairs and routine\u002Fpreventive maintenance on all rotating equipment at DGD.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Assumes responsibility for installation, maintenance and repair of rotating equipment within the refinery.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs maintenance on pumps (centrifugal and positive displacement), steam turbines, compressors (centrifugal and positive displacement), gearboxes (parallel shaft and right angle drive), hydraulic and pneumatic cylinders, process loading arms, fans and blowers and drive systems associated with the equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Properly operates equipment being repaired in order to test, measure and monitor the rotating equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficient in the use of micrometers, dial indicators, laser alignment and various tools used to install and measure the equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Familiar with the basic shop tools such as drill presses, bench grinders, hydraulic presses and hand tools used to work on equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assumes responsibility for changing bearings in some electrical motors.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures that all personnel and equipment are working in a safe manner by following guidelines and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Minimum two years’ experience installing, repairing and maintaining rotating equipment in petrochemical environment required.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Valid Driver’s license required.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Ability to operate equipment such as small lathes, drill press and balancing machines preferred.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Ability to interpret mechanical drawings, equipment data books and maintenance manuals required.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Knowledge of how to measure using precision instruments such as inside\u002Foutside micrometers, Vernier calipers and dial indicators preferred.<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Ability to work call-outs and unscheduled overtime which includes nights, weekends and holidays required.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful> \n   <p>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. <div>\n  Process Engineer-220017G\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Provides engineering capability for process evaluation, optimization of refinery operations, project design, start-up, troubleshooting, and testing of units. Provides technical support for a particular area of the refinery to enable the most optimum performance that will meet the company’s economic, environmental, and safety objectives.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Performs all routine engineering calculations (i.e. mass balances, energy balances, conversion calculations).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Gathers, analyzes, interprets, acts upon, and passes on all pertinent unit operations data.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Generates and maintains an informational database on all pertinent process variables, and updates PFDs and P&amp;IDs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Makes proactive recommendations for improving unit yields and\u002For optimizing energy consumption.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports T\u002FA activities by performing equipment inspections and making necessary recommendations for corrections and or improvements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures that the Planning Department is aware of all current constraints.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiates and justifies new projects, additional monitoring, and other improvements to the unit.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures awareness of all safety, health, and environmental issues that impact the unit, the refinery, and all personnel.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> petroleum refinery required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Must work in a collaborative, on-site work environment, which will include participation in unscheduled discussions and troubleshooting on an as needed basis.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. <div>\n  Sr. Refinery Inspector-22001O9\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Ensures that high quality and timely maintenance and construction work occurs during turnarounds, capital construction projects, and routine maintenance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Inspects (or causes to be inspected) all equipment and piping, which is critical and\u002For subject to periodic deterioration, and makes recommendations on whether repairs are required and what they should be.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains complete and accurate records during inspections so they can be transferred to the permanent files.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates with Maintenance and Operations to ensure equipment is opened in a logical and efficient manner, and the inspection\u002Frepair report is available quickly for planning purposes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates and directs the daily activities of outside inspection contractors during turnarounds and special activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Inspects and monitors all repair and construction work to ensure it is being done per the plans and adheres to all specifications and codes required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors and reports on the activities and quality of contractors in conjunction with their QA\u002FQC representative.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates process and corrosion reviews, revalidation and HAZOP participation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops yearly estimates, budgets and schedules for PCMS &amp; RBI activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Trains others in PCMS &amp; RBI process and API program usage.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of experience in construction, inspection, and repairs of above ground storage tanks preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). <div>\n  HR Advisor-22001HV\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Responsible for a wide variety of all Human Resources Department duties and functions, as well as servicing employees with questions and problems related to a broad array of human resource issues.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Resolves\u002Frefers employee questions or problems related to any aspect of the Human Resource department responsibilities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides support to all employees primarily in the area of benefits, recruitment and general Human Resource issues.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Administers and ensures compliance with state\u002Ffederal regulations including wage and hour laws and EEO\u002FAA guidelines.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides guidance to management and employees on employee related concerns.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists in supervisory development through guidance and training.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists in the implementation of HR policies and procedures and their dissemination through employee handbooks, communications and\u002For meetings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Executes all facets of employment process which includes posting open positions, advertising, recruiting, aptitude testing, screening, interviewing, conducting new hire orientations and communicating with candidates.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists in the coordination of payroll and the resolution of pay issues.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares survey responses on salary, work practices, benefits, job responsibility comparisons, etc.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Gathers information for audit responses.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Serves as an employee advocate and conducts field visits.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with progressive discipline process including investigations, composition of reports, preparation of disciplinary documents and administration of discipline.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes processing of all duties involved in employment, termination, transfer and promotion of personnel.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Authors HR communications including personnel announcements, memos, policies and newsletter – type publications.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with the development and distribution of monthly \u002Fquarterly reports to corporate and refinery management including under utilization and goals for AAP plan, as well as OT and absence statistics.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducts periodic presentations on employee programs to leadership team, management, and employees.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports activities including HR communication initiatives and special projects.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Successfully coordinates special events, employee appreciation activities and employee programs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains positive working relationships throughout the facility.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in the training of lower level HR staff members and assists them with their daily duties as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with the coordination and administration of wellness programs, including conducting periodic presentations on employee programs to HR leadership team and management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Business; major in Psychology, Human Resources, or other related field preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Master’s degree in Human Resources or Labor Relations preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Professional HR certification highly preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A minimum of three years Human Resource generalist experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent written\u002Foral communication skills, presentation skills, organizational skills, independent thinking\u002Fproblem solving skills, multi-tasking abilities and program development required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to perform investigations, provide summaries of results, and make recommendations based on data collected for necessary actions to be taken required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to objectively coach employees and management through employee relations issues required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Must have ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Must have the ability to make recommendations to effectively resolve problems or issues, by using judgment that is consistent with standards, practices, policies, procedures, regulations and\u002For government law required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The ability to research and analyze various data and prepare associated reports required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to organize and prioritize work required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficient experience with Microsoft Office Suite, (e.g. Worked, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) and other software applications required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>SAP experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience working in refinery Human Resources environment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results and communication required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Periodic travel is also required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. <div>\n  Shipping &amp; Receiving Operator - Ethanol Plant-22001SM\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Responsible for loading ethanol and distiller’s grain, work 12-hour rotating day shifts, as well as the movement of trucks and rails cars on the plant site. Ensure maximum production quantity and quality while supporting the policies, goals and objectives of the company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operates and maintains all processes associated with product storage and loading.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Loads ethanol into trucks and railcars.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Loads distiller’s grains into trucks, railcars, and containers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Takes samples of ethanol and distiller’s grains for testing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates meters, bulk weighers, and scales to facilitate product loading.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Creates tickets and issues paperwork to drivers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates locomotive or rail mover to move railcars on plant site to facilitate loading of product.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates large machinery and equipment such as front end loaders and lifts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs. (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs preventive maintenance tasks as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs routine housekeeping duties to maintain a clean work environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors area equipment and assists with maintenance as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates regularly with local rail service to facilitate rail movement activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Experience with the movement and loading of rail cars preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience working with heavy equipment in an industrial environment or grain elevator preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with the operation of front-end loaders, forklift trucks, rail movers, man lifts, and related material handling equipment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with standard computer software programs, i.e. Microsoft Outlook and SAP, preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Linden<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Linden ethanol plant is located near Linden, Indiana, about 60 miles northwest of Indianapolis. The bio-refinery sits on approximately 80 acres and started ethanol production in August 2007. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Linden plant annually processes approximately 46 million bushels of corn into 130 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 385,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 70 full-time personnel.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Maintenance Technician – Ethanol Plant-22001SH\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Responsible for the repair and maintenance of the plant equipment, to ensure maximum production quantity and quality, while supporting the policies, goals, and objectives of the company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Participates in plant maintenance program.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Repairs or replaces plant equipment or systems on a scheduled or emergency basis.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs preventative maintenance activities as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates directly with production and shipping\u002Freceiving department to coordinate maintenance and repair work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with engineering department, external contractors and vendors to implement installation of new equipment or systems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with diagnosing and trouble-shooting maintenance related issues.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with new installations and other projects, as requested by supervisor.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knows and understands city, county, state, and federal regulations relating to maintenance and plant equipment, and works in a safe manner to ensure that these regulations are met at all times.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works a schedule that occasionally requires overtime or call-in as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in plant turnarounds.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in programs and procedures required to ensure plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Health, Safety and Environmental programs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes work orders as assigned.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Two years experience in the maintenance or repair of industrial equipment (pumps, valves, compressors, conveying equipment, etc.) required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Welding experience on carbon\u002Fstainless steel preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the maintenance functions of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the use of hand and power tools preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Albion<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Valero's Albion ethanol plant is located near Albion, Nebraska, about 50 miles southwest of Norfolk. The bio-refinery sits on 107 acres and started ethanol production in October 2007. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Albion plant annually processes approximately 47 million bushels of corn into approximately 135 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 355,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 60 employees.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n <div>\n  Process Operator - Lakota Ethanol Plant-22001IG\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Oversees the daily operation of an assigned area of the production process within the plant. Working a 12-hour rotating shift schedule while maintaining a safe work environment. Monitors and maintains production quality and equipment, while supporting the policies, goals, and objectives of the Company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Monitors and controls plant operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews the operation of the plant constantly to monitor production and quality, anticipating and solving problems in a timely manner, and identifying opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in projects that improve efficiency and\u002For reduce operating costs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Documents and monitors process variables, sample data and routine tasks as required for postion, to ensure plant operations are maintained within operating parameters.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Quality Assurance\u002FQuality Control program, interprets results, and takes appropriate action when required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates with all departments within the facility to ensure safe and efficient execution of daily plant activites.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors and troubleshoot process issues and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs scheduled Operations Work Requests as requested by Supervisor or Plant Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares equipment to ensure it is safe for maintenance\u002Fcontractors to perform scheduled work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Utilizes company safe work practices to ensure all work is performed safely.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in programs and procedures required to ensure plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors use and inventories of process chemicals and supplies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned to maintain a safe, reliable, and consistant operation.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please click on the following link to view what the Process Operator job involves on a day to day basis: <b>Realistic Job Preview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Associate Degree in Process Technology or equivalent preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Lakota<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Lakota ethanol plant is located in Lakota, Iowa, about 30 miles southeast of Fairmont, Minnesota. The bio-refinery sits on 78 acres and started ethanol production in November 2002. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Lakota plant annually processes nearly 39 million bushels of corn into 110 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 400,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery has a nameplate capacity of 85 million gallons of ethanol per year and employs approximately 60 full-time personnel.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. <div>\n  Process Operator - Aurora Ethanol Plant-2300101\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Oversees the daily operation of an assigned area of the production process within the plant. Working a 12-hour rotating shift schedule while maintaining a safe work environment. Monitors and maintains production quality and equipment, while supporting the policies, goals, and objectives of the Company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Monitors and controls plant operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews the operation of the plant constantly to monitor production and quality, anticipating and solving problems in a timely manner, and identifying opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in projects that improve efficiency and\u002For reduce operating costs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Documents and monitors process variables, sample data and routine tasks as required for position, to ensure plant operations are maintained within operating parameters.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Quality Assurance\u002FQuality Control program, interprets results, and takes appropriate action when required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates with all departments within the facility to ensure safe and efficient execution of daily plant activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors and troubleshoot process issues and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs scheduled Operations Work Requests as requested by Supervisor or Plant Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares equipment to ensure it is safe for maintenance\u002Fcontractors to perform scheduled work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Utilizes company safe work practices to ensure all work is performed safely.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in programs and procedures required to ensure plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors use and inventories of process chemicals and supplies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned to maintain a safe, reliable, and consistent operation.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p>Please click on the following link to view what the Process Operator job involves on a day to day basis: <b>Realistic Job Preview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Associate Degree in Process Technology or equivalent preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Aurora<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Aurora ethanol plant is located near Aurora, South Dakota, six miles east of Brookings and 60 miles north of Sioux Falls. The bio-refinery sits on 420 acres and started ethanol production in November 2003. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. Recognized as the ethanol industry's first 100 million-gallon-per-year production facility, the Aurora plant now annually processes approximately 49 million bushels of corn into approximately 140 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 368,000 tons of distiller grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 65 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n <div>\n  Sr. Loss Control Specialist - Benicia, CA-22001OP\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Provides quality \u002F quantity assurance with emphasis on control of product losses for all movements of crude oil and petroleum products. Provides Valero coverage on custody transfer movements at company owned and non-owned locations around the world as well as offshore locations.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Identifies issues that expose Valero to additional costs, and based on this exposure, assumes the authority to take steps to mitigate the exposure. These steps may include anything from appointing additional oversight to suspending cargo operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimizes losses that may result from errors or inconsistencies in measurement, sampling, or testing of petroleum products by proactive attendance of custody movements for compliance with Valero published industry standards.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Identifies excessive product losses or quality discrepancies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures that API guidelines and the Company's hydrocarbon measurement procedures are followed with full documentation of events.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Encourages uniform petroleum cargo measurement and inspection practices.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and implements systems which will alert management in a timely manner to potentially serious inventory and loss problems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Encourages a favorable perception of the Company's commitment to environment, general public welfare, and profit control.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Facilitates discussions to develop and execute alternative action plans as deviations from standard practice occur.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates with vessel officers and shore representatives to determine if additional oversight is required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Verifies and confirms volumes with independent inspectors.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>May be required to perform physical measurement and sampling of marine vessels, railcars, trucks, storage tanks and other containers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reinforces the companies “Life Saving Rules” to all employees and strive to set the example for the Loss Control group.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates the performance of inspection companies and their inspectors.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiates record and report departmental cost savings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates and reviews industry standards and policies (API\u002FASTM) to maintain skill set needed to implement improvements to reduce Valero’s exposure to losses.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Witnesses custody meter proving and meter prover calibrations. Initiate actions to ensure proper meter factors are determined and properly applied in the final calculation of volumes.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The salary range for this position is $78,480 to $107,910 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor's degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of experience custody transfer measurements, loss control and\u002For marine\u002Fterminal inspection related experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Technical knowledge of testing, inspection procedures, and marine operations related to transferring of oil required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working knowledge of API guidelines for custody measurement; previous field experience with knowledge of terminals and marine vessels preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Able and willing to work 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, including holidays, as needed, required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Able and willing to lift 50 pounds occasionally and 20 pounds of force frequently required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Safety Engineer-22001P9\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Interacts and works with the site Operations organization. Develops and maintains good communication, presentation and interpersonal skills that help Operations and other functional groups implement those process changes or procedures necessary to comply with the regulations and requirements. Remains responsive to routine requests for Information from Operations and other functional groups. Facilitates the writing or writes site safety procedures and helps Operations and other functional groups translate requirements into written procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and recommends business driven and cost-effective strategies: Demonstrates an untiring effort to find new and better ways to comply with new and existing regulations and requirements that reduce the burden on Operations and other functional groups.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and delivers training to the site for safety issues: Develops training materials pertaining to safety issues as required by the site due to new or changing Federal or State regulations. Provides the training materials to the parties responsible for delivering site training or may deliver the training directly to the site employees.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains records to demonstrate compliance. Reviews plant modifications for safety systems and supporting documentation to illustrate compliance to the regulations and VPP Star requirements with confidence and ease. Interacts with agency inspectors in a manner that minimizes negative impacts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Negotiations with Agencies. Develops the confidence, capability, and willingness to maintain the site's position with an agency representative, as appropriate, on the interpretation and applicability of a regulation or requirement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Trade Association meetings (e.g. Tcc, VPPPA, ASSE) for assigned field.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with supervisor on professional and personal development and career planning.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reduces safety costs through the implementation of Best Practices at the site.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with the region and other site safety organizations on consolidated contracts which add value to the organization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports opportunity projects (e.g. ERT training requirements, etc.) in the most cost effective manner.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with Operations and the regional organization to maintain compliance so that unwarranted agency inspections do not occur. Develops a business oriented behavior for implementing regulatory requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and maintains a working knowledge of the site and processes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with Operations and the regional organization to implement processes to meet regulatory requirements and ensure operating flexibility.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates process changes for safety impact or compliance (Management of Change).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates new chemicals for safety impact or compliance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Holds signature authority to issue releases against standing purchasing orders at the discretion of the Site HSE Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor's or higher level degree in Engineering or related Science is required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>2 years of safety experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience representing a company to regulatory agencies is required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. <div>\n  Logistics &amp; Loss Control Projects Manager-22001T5\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero Energy is looking for a <b>Logistics &amp; Loss Control Projects Manager<\u002Fb> to join our team at the <b>San Antonio Headquarters<\u002Fb>. The Logistics &amp; Loss Control Projects Manager manages a team that supports logistics and loss control capital project initiatives. The Logistics &amp; Loss Control Projects Manager oversees logistics simulation developer activities and special projects relative to transportation and commercial initiatives. The Logistics &amp; Loss Control Projects Manager is accountable to drive process improvement initiatives across Commercial and Refinery organizations that optimize asset utilization, vessel predictability, and operational efficiencies. The Logistics &amp; Loss Control Projects Manager facilitates relations with industry and marine logistics stakeholders and stewards project initiatives that improve loss control measurement infrastructure.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Logistics &amp; Loss Control Projects Manager duties may include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Stewards relationships with Port Commissions, Navigation Districts, US Army Corp of Engineers, industry stakeholders, community \u002F governmental affairs, and Valero refinery\u002Fterminal personnel.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manages logistics simulation development activities and advocates with stakeholders to initiate projects that alleviate constraints and increase import and export capabilities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Champions development of logistics or loss control capital expenditure projects, by leading and facilitating the discovery, analysis and justification considerations in preparation for Design Review Board process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops the annual logistics and loss control capital expenditure budget relative to the strategic plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Liaisons with internal groups to achieve strategic initiatives to include Refining Operations, Crude Supply &amp; Trading, Product Supply &amp; Trading, Planning &amp; Economics, and Business Development.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides leadership for marine logistics analysis and strategic loss control project initiatives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Oversees information sources for Valero’s refinery and terminal logistics attributes that prescribes throughput capabilities, including their capacities, capabilities, limitations and improvement opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Negotiates rate change proposals with Marine Pilot Associations<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides leadership support for third party terminal dock operations as needed to achieve commercial objectives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with Valero Refinery and Terminal Operations and Engineering leadership to insure efficient and optimum supply chain logistics<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor's or higher level degree - in engineering, finance &amp; economics, business or related required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>10+ years of experience in the following area(s): Planning &amp; economics, transportation logistics, crude or product supply planning\u002Fscheduling required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Master’s or higher level degree - in engineering, finance &amp; economics, or business school preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the petroleum marine transportation or other logistics\u002Fsupply chain-related field preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge of measurement assurance equipment and technologies preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience working with Port Authorities, Navigation Districts, and US Army Corp of Engineers preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Must be able to work in a collaborative, on-site work environment, which will include participation in unscheduled discussions and troubleshooting on an as needed basis.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Contracts Auditor-230010C\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Assists Internal Audit Management in the optimization of profits, safeguarding of Corporate assets and ensuring the reliability and accuracy of financial data by making an examination and appraisal of financial and operating controls and procedures to provide comments and recommendations concerning activities reviewed.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Examines activities of all areas of the Corporation to determine the extent of compliance with policies, plans, procedures, rules of regulatory agencies and contracts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates to the extent possible through the audit process, managerial effectiveness in the attainment of objectives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with audit project planning, including initial client interviews, preparation of audit planning memorandums, and risk matrices.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with the development of audit program procedures to address risks identified in the approved risk matrices.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Executes, audit procedures utilizing data mining tools and critical thinking, and clearly and concisely documents testing performed and findings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Keeps audit in-charge informed of execution issues and findings. Develops practical recommendations which will be accepted by management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Advises audit in-charge of the need for subject matter expertise to ensure the efficient execution of the audit, including the need for IT audit involvement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with the preparation of written reports of audit results and the follow up of audit recommendations made to ensure implementation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Internal Audit management with administrative responsibilities as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Successful candidates will have (required):<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor's or higher level degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field<\u002Fli> \n   <li>3 years of combined experience in internal auditing, public accounting, and\u002For general accounting<\u002Fli> \n   <li>General understanding of generally accepted accounting principles and theories, generally accepted auditing standards, and ability to analyze their application in the Corporation's accounting records<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>The most competitive candidates will have (preferred):<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>1 year of internal audit experience<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the refining and marketing business<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience using data analytic\u002Fdatabase tools (ACL, IDEA, ACCESS, SQL, or other querying tools)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>SAP systems experience<\u002Fli> \n   <li>1 relevant professional designation: CPA, CIA, CISA, and\u002For CFE<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, contracts, and other work-related documentation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results, and communications<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Skill in providing thorough, efficient, and effective customer service to individuals at all levels within the organization<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to communicate effectively through written and verbal methods<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to utilize data mining and other electronic analytical tools to scrutinize data to identify patterns<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>The above description reflects the primary job function and may not include all detailed job functions performed in the role.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding? It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. <div>\n  Logistics &amp; Scheduling Analyst - DP-2300106\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Responsible for scheduling movement of feedstocks for DGD renewable diesel plant including but not limited to animal fat, used cooking oil, and corn oil by rail or truck or barge. Also responsible for scheduling of any pretreatment processing aids or chemicals that are delivered via rail or truck. <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Manages all rail\u002Ftruck shipments coming to DGD facility<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Serves as principle contact to the rail line and feedstock producers’ operations teams<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Responsible for sending in daily orders to line<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with Commercial management to ensure feedstock logistics\u002Fintake process is efficient and sufficient for DGD’s needs<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with Transportation team to help resolve shipping problems and expedite orders when there are delays or delivery issues<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures DGD receives appropriate shipping documentation (Certificates of Analysis, bills of lading, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducts efficient and effective order entry, execution and maintenance<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Tracks railcars on a daily basis to confirm product is moving efficiently per DGD needs<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Creates and passes on clear unloading orders to Rail Unloaders that include steam and unloading priorities<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates with feedstock producers and rail logistics on any transport equipment issues<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Enters rail\u002Ftruck orders to company SAP\u002FMTS systems<\u002Fli> \n   <li>May assist in feedstock procurement<\u002Fli> \n   <li>May handle larger and\u002For more complex transactions. May provide guidance to more junior schedulers<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Other duties as assigned<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A minimum of three plus years of scheduling and procurement experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, and other work-related documentation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results, and communications.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Skill in providing thorough, efficient, and effective customer service to individuals at all levels within the organization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to communicate effectively through written and verbal methods.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to accomplish work within required timelines, including short, long, and emergency timeframes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to cross-train in other department duties to ensure efficient coverage in departmental responsibilities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work with others to accomplish challenging assignments.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple assignments to ensure completion of tasks within stated time requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic skill in using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word and Excel).<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. <div>\n  Administrative Assistant Scale House - Ethanol Plant-22001QW\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Performs clerical and administrative functions for personnel throughout the plant. Position includes providing support in the Scale House by Safely and efficiently weighing raw materials\u002Fchemicals (corn and dried distiller’s grains) in and out.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Oversees reception area—greeting guests, answering telephones, and routing visitors and\u002For calls to appropriate area or person.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reads and routes incoming mail, locating and attaching appropriate file to correspondence to assist employer in dealing with correspondence.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Composes and produces routine correspondence.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Organizes and maintains file system—filing correspondence and other records.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducts research as requested—compiling and typing statistical reports.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates and arranges meetings—preparing agendas, reserving and preparing facilities, etc.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with preparing for plant tours.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Arranges conference calls as requested.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists in arranging and coordinating travel schedules and reservations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares outgoing mail and correspondence, including e-mail, Federal Express, and faxes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with ordering and maintaining office supplies, working within the defined budget.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates computerized scales (SAP software system) to ensure accuracy of all transactions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Grades all incoming samples of corn proficiently and accurately using manual and automated equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Associate's degree (or higher) from a business school preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum 3 years of administrative or secretarial experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience using Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint or SAP preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience providing customer service to truck drivers preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience operating automated scales and corn sampling equipment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Welcome<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero Renewables-Welcome is located near Welcome, Minnesota, about four miles west of Fairmont and 100 miles southwest of Minneapolis. The bio-refinery sits on approximately 300 acres and started ethanol production in June 2009. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Welcome plant annually processes nearly 43 million bushels of corn into 120 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 400,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery has a nameplate capacity of 110 million gallons of ethanol per year and employs approximately 75 full-time personnel.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><br> Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Sr. Technical Trainer-230010I\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Effectively performs necessary work tasks to develop, maintain, and present materials for the purpose of training and educating all site employees. Develops and conducts programs to train employees in installation, operation, safety, maintenance, and repair of machinery and equipment. Designs and develops instructional material for computer-based training and other delivery platforms.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Plans and coordinates the different components of the site’s training function.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Partners with Operations, Maintenance, and Laboratory leadership to ensure all employee training, testing, and progression activities are completed on schedule.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates closely with HR regarding employee training\u002Fcertification completion that results in pay adjustment or job advancement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates effectively with Front-line Supervisors to identify the most efficient time and place to schedule training activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and delivers training programs (Instructor Lead and Computer Based), including outlines, text, handouts, tests, and designing training exercises.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates training facilities and resources in advance of training activities such as training content; PowerPoint presentation; training aids; and classroom setup.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proctors knowledge-based tests and assists subject-matter expert\u002Ftrainer with performance-based testing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Verifies that training activity documentation is complete and properly retained.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs internal reviews, surveys and\u002For interviews with attendees to evaluate training course effectiveness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Observes trainees during classroom exercises and answers questions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates thorough knowledge of responsible complex units, crafts, equipment in the field, and\u002For other specialized areas, as directed by the Technical Training Supervisor\u002FSuperintendent.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates implementation and execution of Corporate Training initiatives, such as the Basic Operator Training program.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates the Qualification\u002FRefresher Operations Training program.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Mentors and trains Basic Operator Trainees.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides test remediation and reassessment support for all job required training.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews and updates training materials and tests as appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Schedules, proctors and reviews all Operations assessment \u002F test activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops training schedules (periodic and annual).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Corporate Health, Safety, PSM and Environmental audits to verify that site training is properly documented and meets or exceeds organizational requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists lower level training staff with duties as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High School diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of training development experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Process operations experience in a refinery environment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. <div>\n  Mechanic II (Instrument Tech II)-22001T1\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Position is responsible to perform troubleshooting, calibration, repair and installation of instruments, electronic devices, computer digital equipment and electrical equipment.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Maintains and repairs electronic and pneumatic instrumentation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Possesses a basic understanding and application of instrumentation math, and units of measurement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates knowledge of flow, pressure, temperature, and level instrumentation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains and troubleshoots various types of solenoid valves, switches, meters, indicators, and temperature sensors.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uses test equipment and performs routine calibrations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates ability to read and interpret P&amp;IDs, loop drawings, and wiring schematics.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs work activities in a safe and environmentally sound manner.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Valid Driver’s license required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     A minimum of 2 years experience as an Instrument Technician OR a degree in an instrumentation field is required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to work call-outs and unscheduled overtime which includes nights, weekends and holidays required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must
