<div>\n  Process Operator - Hartley Ethanol Plant-22001QD\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Oversees the daily operation of an assigned area of the production process within the plant. Working a 12-hour rotating shift schedule while maintaining a safe work environment. Monitors and maintains production quality and equipment, while supporting the policies, goals, and objectives of the Company.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Monitors and controls plant operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews the operation of the plant constantly to monitor production and quality, anticipating and solving problems in a timely manner, and identifying opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in projects that improve efficiency and\u002For reduce operating costs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Documents and monitors process variables, sample data and routine tasks as required for position, to ensure plant operations are maintained within operating parameters.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Quality Assurance\u002FQuality Control program, interprets results, and takes appropriate action when required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates with all departments within the facility to ensure safe and efficient execution of daily plant activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors and troubleshoot process issues and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs scheduled Operations Work Requests as requested by Supervisor or Plant Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares equipment to ensure it is safe for maintenance\u002Fcontractors to perform scheduled work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Utilizes company safe work practices to ensure all work is performed safely.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in safety, health, and environmental programs (LOTO-lock out tag out, Safe Work Permit, FSMA-Food Safety Modernization Act).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in programs and procedures required to ensure plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors use and inventories of process chemicals and supplies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned to maintain a safe, reliable, and consistent operation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>Please click on the following link to view what the Process Operator job involves on a day to day basis: <b>Realistic Job Preview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Associate Degree in Process Technology or equivalent preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Experience in the operation of a dry-mill ethanol plant preferred.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Hartley<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Hartley ethanol plant is located near Hartley, Iowa, about 100 miles southeast of Sioux Falls, South Dakota. The bio-refinery sits on approximately 350 acres and started ethanol production in August 2008. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Hartley plant annually processes approximately 49 million bushels of corn into approximately 140 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 368,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 70 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. <div>\n  Payroll Associate II-22001DP\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Prepares payroll records for processing and assists employees and refinery HR with questions concerning payroll, time reporting, or company policies. Ensures accurate and timely payroll.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Compiles, verifies, and enters timecard data into the payroll system.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports Supervisors with Kronos scheduling.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Determines and tracks time reporting (leave, overtime, holiday, callout work, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides training to new hires and current employees with timecard procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews, analyzes, and checks payroll journals to ensure accuracy and makes the necessary adjustments or corrections as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with verifying payroll information for all new hires, current employees, and past employees.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with the processing and distribution of regular and off-cycle (meal overtime, etc.) paychecks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Runs and distributes various payroll and monthly, quarterly, and annual reports (manpower, employee listings, overtime, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with tracking Attendance Management absences.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with fatigue management reporting and manages exceptions in database.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains payroll procedures manual and Kronos manual.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains local pay practices document.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with ordering and generating yearly Operations shift calendar.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with generating yearly vacation packages\u002Ftemplates and memos.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports employees with expense reports and per diem requests.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Handles office supply inventory and ordering.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manages mail distribution.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assist with employee newsletter and HR portal<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with planning and implementing employees' events.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Answers walk-in, telephone, and e-mail inquiries.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows all safety rules and guidelines as established by the Refinery.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Other duties may be assigned.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The rate for this position is $42,240 to $58,080 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>3 years of payroll experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Accounting, or related field preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Kronos experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>SAP experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Microsoft Office Programs (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Benicia Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero acquired the Benicia Refinery in 2000. Built as a grass-roots project in 1968, this plant has undergone significant modifications and upgrades to become what it is today one of the most complex refineries in the United States. Approximately 70 percent of the refinery’s product slate is California Air Resources Board (CARB) gasoline, California’s clean-burning fuel. The refinery also has significant asphalt production capabilities and produces 35 percent of the asphalt supply in northern California. Currently, the refinery processes domestic crude from the San Joaquin Valley in California and the Alaska North Slope, along with foreign sour crudes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status including sexual orientation, gender identity, Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<br> *LI-LP1<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  Staff Process Engineer -220017H\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Provides senior level engineering capability for process evaluation, optimization of refinery operations, project design, start-up, troubleshooting, and testing of units. Expertise to provide the most optimum refinery performance that will meet the company’s safety, environmental, reliability and economic objectives.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provides technical expertise to support process units for a particular area of the refinery to enable the most optimum performance that will meet daily operating targets and KPIs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs all routine engineering calculations (i.e. piping hydraulics; PSV sizing; pump\u002Fmotor sizing and evaluations; use process simulation software to evaluate complex problems, size\u002Frate equipment, mass and energy balances; perform conversion calculations).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors unit operating data. Ensures technical and operations management are aware of all current constraints.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Operations in evaluations of unit operations and troubleshooting problems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares and follows-up on reports on catalyst life, performance, regeneration, and requirements of the units.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiates proactive recommendations for improving unit yields and\u002For optimizing energy consumption.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understands the refinery flows, heat and material balances, feeds, distillation processes and products.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains and evaluates an informational database of operating history of units for all pertinent process variables and updates PFD’s, P&amp;ID’s, and Unit Health Monitoring KPIs. Performs studies on the effects of operating variables on product quality, yield and profitability.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists in supplying technical data in preparation of construction, operating, and environmental permit applications and reports.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiates and develops process design for new projects to address safety, environmental concerns, reliability, and other economic improvements to the unit.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes conceptual process studies\u002Fevaluations and determine the economic feasibility. Prepares project design basis document for the study. Develops lead case selection from an alternative analysis evaluation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes process designs for proposed projects; writes process specifications based on studies for problem solving, optimization, or new projects. These include process flow diagrams, heat and material balance, and P&amp;IDs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares Decision Support Packages, Business Cases and assist in AFE preparation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and evaluates plans and criteria to execute a variety of projects.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports T\u002FA activities by participating in pre-TA planning scope reviews and project development, performing equipment inspections, assisting with catalyst loading, chemical cleaning applications and making necessary recommendations for corrections and or improvements for discovery items. Issues Post TA Report of significant findings and lessons learned.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Issues Monthly formal Unit Performance report, formal reports on specific subjects, informal discussions, attend Operations Line Team Meetings and a weekly Process Engineering Group meeting. Formal and informal presentations given to Senior Management team members.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelors of Science degree or higher degree in Chemical Engineering required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of process engineering experience in a petroleum refinery required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Process Simulation experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Must be able to work in a collaborative, on-site work environment, which will include participation in unscheduled discussions and troubleshooting on an as needed basis.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in petroleum refining with multiple refinery process units preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<br> <br> Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status including sexual orientation, gender identity, Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>LI-LP1<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Job:<\u002Fb> Engineering\n <div>\n  Associate Accounting Coordinator-2300108\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Under immediate supervision, processes less complex accounts receivable, accounts payable, and related transactions in SAP according to established policies and procedures. Coordinates with external and internal customers\u002Fvendors to ensure all assigned transactions are recorded accurately and in a timely manner for cash collections, payment, and accounting close purposes.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Records journal entries, performs reconciliations, and makes adjustments and\u002For corrections as necessary.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Processes bulk refined product purchases and sales for timely payment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates and works with internal and external customers\u002Fvendors to ensure proper recording\u002Fclassification of transactions, verify accuracy of pricing and volumes, and review and ensure compliance with customer and vendor contracts and deal sheet terms.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs month-end closing duties to ensure accurate financial reporting (e.g., review accounts receivable\u002Fpayable, reporting, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews EMTS workbench and pending report for vendors.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with special projects for management or other operational areas as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Accounting preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>1 year of Accounting experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Refinery or related experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic understanding of contract terms and their application preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic understanding of generally accepted accounting principles, theories, and ability to apply them to the Corporation's accounting needs preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to coordinate with various departments and outside customers in a timely manner preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, and other work-related documentation preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results, and communications preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Skill in providing thorough, efficient, and effective customer service to individuals at all levels within the organization preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to communicate effectively through written and verbal methods preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to accomplish work within required timelines, including short, long, and emergency timeframes preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to cross-train in other department duties to ensure efficient coverage of department responsibilities preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work with others to accomplish challenging assignments preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple assignments to ensure completion of tasks within stated time requirements preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Advanced skill using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word and Excel) preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working knowledge of SAP preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. <div>\n  Associate Health Safety &amp; Environmental Specialist - Ethanol Plant-22001QU\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Assists with the ongoing implementation and maintenance of systems to meet environmental, health and safety regulations\u002Fperformance for ethanol production facility.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Supports the implementation of processes and procedures to maintain compliance with all applicable local, state and federal regulations and permits under OSHA, TTB, FRA, EPA and state environmental agencies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports the facility’s Emergency Action Plan (EAP), Integrated Contingency Plan (ICP), Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasures (SPCC), and Risk Management Plan (RMP).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assits in maintaining the facility’s commitments under the sites Air, Appropriations, NPDES, and Waste permits. Completes multi-media responsibility for task driven commitments.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Establishes and maintains relationship with local fire departments and response organizations to facilitate their participation in the Facility Response Plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains and ensures implementation of assigned elements of Process Safety Management (PSM).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures implementation of Safe Work Practices (SWP), including providing training and making required changes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Implements site security plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures Fugitive VOC emissions compliance. Maintains LeakDAS inventory and conducts monitoring as necessary.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with other departments to ensure completion of Title V compliance tasks (insepctions, logs, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows through on tasks defined on Environmental Health and Safety Routine Duties Calendar, ensuring 100% compliance with assigned tasks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains Environmental Health &amp; Safety policies and procedures, as assigned.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains Chemical Management System, including driving change as necessary.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains compliance data systems, providing clear, timely access to information for routine reporting.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides support to the site’s Safety Committee and the Hazard Recognition Inspection Team (HRIT).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains site portable gas meters and conducts monthly calibrations, repair as necessary. Tracks calibrations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures Industrial Hygiene testing is conducted. Coordinates sampling and training with contractor.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures systems are in place to provide required compliance and site’s performance for all areas of responsibility.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops training schedule and provides instructor-led training.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with maintaining HSE training calendar.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Safety\u002FEnvironmental Sciences or related technical field preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>At least one year of experience in operating industrial facility subject to environmental, health and safety regulations preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the area of industry, energy or manufacturing preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Bluffton<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Bluffton ethanol plant is located in Bluffton, Indiana, about 30 miles south of Fort Wayne. The bio-refinery sits on 422 acres and started ethanol production in September 2008. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Bluffton plant annually processes nearly 45 million bushels of corn into 130 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 340,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery has a nameplate capacity of 110 million gallons of ethanol per year and employs approximately 65 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.\n   <br> \n <div>\n  Staff Electrical Engineer-22001KS\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Provides electrical engineering support to refinery electrical power distribution system. Supports in planning and execution of capital and maintenance projects, provides electrical assistance to Maintenance and Operations departments, and develops electrical system reliability programs and procedures that ensure the Refinery electrical system is operating at maximum efficiency and reliability.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provides technical assistance to the refinery on routine daily electrical issues, including providing troubleshooting assistance to the Electricians, making recommendations to the refinery on field repairs, interpretation of Electrical data gathered during Preventative Maintenance Work orders, and consultations with Design Engineering on electrical design packages.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Operations and Maintenance Departments during Electrical System Disturbances.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Creates and updates electrical drawings such as one-line diagrams, motor schematics, panel schedules, and other related drawings as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares and submit Management of Change (MOC) documentation related to electrical systems and projects and champion the change process through to Pre-Startup Safety Review, Startup of the change and Closeout of the MOC.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and stewards electrical system reliability improvement opportunities, including participation in development and execution of a strategy to improve plant electrical reliability. This strategy involves capital improvement, preventive maintenance, repair strategies, etc.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Updates and maintains ETAP electrical system model as electrical system additions and changes occur.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares Refinery short circuit studies, load flow studies, arc flash studies, and motor starting studies as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares high voltage switching procedures. Coordinate and oversee the execution of these procedures by Operations or Maintenance personnel.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proposes amendments to Electrical Safety Policy as necessary to address latest codes and technology.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Makes decisions independently on engineering problems and methods, and represents the organization in meetings to resolve important questions and to plan and coordinate work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides functional and final checkouts of new and modified Electrical System Installations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Serves as site representative for Valero’s electrical safety and reliability network in monthly phone meetings and yearly face to face meetings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in incident investigations and assists in generating incident reports or failure analyses for incidents involving electrical system disturbances and electrical equipment failures.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The salary range for this position is $143,440 to $197,230 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Electrical Engineering required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>8 years of directly related electrical engineering experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with Power Engineering preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Benicia Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero acquired the Benicia Refinery in 2000. Built as a grass-roots project in 1968, this plant has undergone significant modifications and upgrades to become what it is today one of the most complex refineries in the United States. Approximately 70 percent of the refinery’s product slate is California Air Resources Board (CARB) gasoline, California’s clean-burning fuel. The refinery also has significant asphalt production capabilities and produces 35 percent of the asphalt supply in northern California. Currently, the refinery processes domestic crude from the San Joaquin Valley in California and the Alaska North Slope, along with foreign sour crudes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status including sexual orientation, gender identity, Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<br> *LI-LP1<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  Sr Project Engineer-22001GK\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Provides technical expertise for development, design and execution of capital, expense and maintenance projects in a safe, profitable, timely and efficient manner.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Develops designs, performs cost estimation and prepares\u002Fsubmits “Authorization for Expenditures” (AFE’s) for capital and expense projects per process design.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares specifications and procure materials and equipment for a timely and efficient execution of projects.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides technical support to all refinery departments that will result in safe, efficient and cost effective installations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supervises contract personnel for engineering, design and installation of capital, expense and maintenance projects.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs cost tracking and status reporting for assigned projects.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manages multiple projects simultaneously within a managed budget and execution schedule.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows all safety rules and guidelines as established by the Refinery.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The salary range for this position is $117,600 to $161,700 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor's or higher level degree in Engineering required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of experience in engineering and project management, with at least 3 years of exposure in a refinery\u002Fpetrochemical-operating environment required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Benicia Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero acquired the Benicia Refinery in 2000. Built as a grass-roots project in 1968, this plant has undergone significant modifications and upgrades to become what it is today one of the most complex refineries in the United States. Approximately 70 percent of the refinery’s product slate is California Air Resources Board (CARB) gasoline, California’s clean-burning fuel. The refinery also has significant asphalt production capabilities and produces 35 percent of the asphalt supply in northern California. Currently, the refinery processes domestic crude from the San Joaquin Valley in California and the Alaska North Slope, along with foreign sour crudes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status including sexual orientation, gender identity, Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. <div>\n  Lead Refinery Analysis Accounting Specialist-22001LW\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Leads and executes the day to day accounting and analysis activities which may include the Refinery’s financial planning, capital budgeting, cost accounting, expense budgeting, problem resolution, internal and external audit coordination, Solomon reporting, managing complex agreements, financial and statistical reporting and strategy development.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Prepares daily analysis, which may include the Refinery’s financial planning, capital budgeting, cost accounting, expense budgeting, internal and external audit coordination, financial and statistical reporting, and\u002For strategy development.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with Project Engineering, Key Maintenance representatives, local Planning &amp; Economics, Corporate Planning &amp; Economics, Marketing &amp; Supply and Refinery Operations groups as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Applies knowledge to solve problems across departmental lines.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares ad hoc analysis as requested by refinery and headquarters customers to aid in budget stewardship.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists other refineries and business units with ad hoc analysis as requested.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares refinery financial forecasts, results of operations, capital budget and expense budgets, prepares analysis of variances to plan, Solomon survey preparation, turnaround stewardship and planning, preparation of various financial and operating reports, onsite controls management, inventory management, headquarters accounting close support, and budget management support.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manages accounting, develops and monitors controls and coordinates transactions to record effects of complex agreements such as steam, refinery gas and electricity sales. Resolves differences between internal and external parties per contract terms and prepares accounting transactions as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides guidance and direction to other staff; handles and resolve complex accounting issues as a subject matter expert.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Back-up Refinery Controller as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows safety rules and procedures as set forth by the company.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher-level degree in Accounting required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>8 years of accounting experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>CPA certification preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Master’s degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the refining industry and\u002For chemical manufacturing industry preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to be geographically mobile preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working knowledge of SAP preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Thorough understanding of generally accepted accounting principles, theories, and ability to apply them to the Corporation's accounting needs required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong analytical skills required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, and other work-related documentation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results, and communications.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Skill in providing thorough, efficient, and effective customer service to individuals at all levels within the organization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to communicate effectively through written and verbal methods.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to accomplish work within required timelines, including short, long, and emergency timeframes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to cross-train in other department duties to ensure efficient coverage department responsibilities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work with others to accomplish challenging assignments.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple assignments to ensure completion of tasks within stated time requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficiency using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word and Excel).<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. <div>\n  Associate IT Auditor-230010R\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Supports Valero’s business objective through internal information technology (IT) audits, integrated audits, and consulting reviews, by helping to maximize profitability, maintain maximum operational efficiency of its business units, protect Corporate information assets, and ensure the reliability and accuracy of information systems and technology.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Under direct supervision, reviews and tests controls in IT systems and functions for the Corporation to ensure the security and integrity of corporate information assets and continuity of operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Examines automated systems and information technology in all areas of the Corporation to determine the extent of compliance with policies, plans, procedures, and rules of regulatory agencies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Under direct supervision, performs examinations and appraisals of IT systems and operating controls and procedures using the following methods and techniques: IT risk analysis; IT control identification and evaluation; IT audit program execution and integrated audit program execution; computer assisted audit techniques (CAATs); development of IT control or efficiency recommendations that will be accepted by management; written documentation of audit findings, recommendations, and other audit activity; audit follow up to ensure implementation of recommendations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluates IT management effectiveness in the attainment of IT objectives.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor's or higher level degree in Management Information Systems (MIS), Computer Science, Accounting, Finance, or related field required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>1 year of internal auditing, information technology, or public accounting experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the refining and marketing business preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience using data analytic\u002Fdatabase tools (ACL, IDEA, ACCESS, SQL, or other querying tools) preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>SAP systems experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>General Computing Control audit experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>1 relevant professional designation preferred: CISA, CIA, and\u002For CISSP<\u002Fli> \n   <li>General understanding of the practice and principles of computer automation preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficiency with electronic spreadsheets, database management systems, and data query software are required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, and other work-related documentation preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results, and communications preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Skill in providing thorough, efficient, and effective customer service to individuals at all levels within the organization preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to communicate effectively through written and verbal methods preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to accomplish work within required timelines, including short, long, and emergency timeframes preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to cross-train in other department duties to ensure efficient coverage department responsibilities preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work with others to accomplish challenging assignments preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple assignments to ensure completion of tasks within stated time requirements preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic skill using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word and Excel) preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. <div>\n  Sr. Environmental Engineer -22001FF\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Maintains up-to-date knowledge of existing Texas and Federal Air regulations and proposed environmental regulations to ensure continued compliance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Forecasts the impact of regulatory changes on refinery operations and advises and recommends to management effective methods to implement changes. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Negotiates with regulatory agencies favorable environmental permits for the refinery, reviews refinery processes, and recommends changes to maintain compliance. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Develops and implements environmental compliance programs at the refinery. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Understands and interprets regulatory requirements and determines the impact of these requirements on refinery operations. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Presents issues to refinery management and corporate to develop corrective actions, if required. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Communicates effectively and clearly the refinery’s positions to 1) regulatory agencies, 2) corporate, and 3) civic organizations. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensures assigned Spill\u002FUpset\u002FEmission Event\u002FReporting requirements are satisfied in accordance with all applicable regulations. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensures assigned federal, state or applicable government reporting obligations (e.g., SARA 313 reports; Emission Inventories; NSPS Reports; MACT Reports; TCEQ Regulation Reports, Title V, etc.) are completed in a timely and compliant manner. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensures operational records necessary to demonstrate compliance with assigned environmental regulations\u002Fprograms are acquired, recorded, and properly retained. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensures emission control equipment inspections required by environmental regulations and programs assigned are properly satisfied, recorded, and reported to state, federal, or other government authorities, as applicable. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensures on-going compliance with assigned environmental regulations and permits. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Communicates effectively with Engineering and Operations personnel to ensure compliance with environmental regulations and permits is continually achieved. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Performs other duties as assigned.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This <div>\n  Manager Health, Safety Environmental - Ethanol Plant-22001OO\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Responsible for managing all aspects of environmental, health and safety, and regulatory compliance.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Participates in objective setting, plan development and performance review of plant performance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures compliance with all applicable regulations and permits under OSHA (including PSM), EPA, DENR, TTB, FRA and any other non-financial regulating body.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Owns overall management system structure for compliance assurance and integrates all compliance tools into plant operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures all plant modifications receive appropriate permitting approval in timely manner to support construction schedule and all plant\u002Fsystem changes are managed through plant Management of Change (MOC) procedure.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains positive, proactive relationships with all regulatory contacts creating easy communication flow and positive view of plant by regulators.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures systems are in place to provide complete compliance with all regulations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures training systems provide proper platform to promote ever increasing standards for safe work execution.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with plant leadership team to implement changes that increase performance in all EH&amp;S areas.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures all required compliance audits are performed, gaps are communicated and deficiency plans are developed and implemented.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops leading and lagging measures that clearly articulate plant performance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Writes monthly reports on accomplishments, gaps and improvement plan progress.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and implements succession plan for future plants and projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree (or higher degree) in Engineering, Safety or Environmental Sciences required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A minimum of ten years of overall work experience in an operating industrial facility required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A minimum of five years of experience in a Health, Safety, or Environmental role working in an industrial facility subject to OSHA 1910 and applicable EPA regulations or comparable experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with state pollution control standards preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Fort Dodge<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Fort Dodge ethanol plant is located near Fort Dodge, Iowa, just less than 100 miles northwest of Des Moines. The bio-refinery sits on 270 acres and started ethanol production in September 2005. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Fort Dodge plant annually processes approximately 49 million bushels of corn into approximately 140 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 368,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 65 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n troubleshooting\u002Fprogramming experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Valero Renewables – Albion<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <p>Valero's Albion ethanol plant is located near Albion, Nebraska, about 50 miles southwest of Norfolk. The bio-refinery sits on 107 acres and started ethanol production in October 2007. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Albion plant annually processes approximately 46 million bushels of corn into approximately 130 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 385,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 65 full-time personnel.<\u002Fp> \n   <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. <div>\n  Accounting Associate - Ethanol Plant-22001S6\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Reviews and prepares accounting documents and validations reviewed by or sent to the Plant Controller or Corporate (SAHQ). Completes activities necessary to calculate, process, post, verify and maintain data for Valero Renewables working under the direction of the Plant Controller.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provides assistance to Plant Accountants, other Associates in regards to auditing, budget reporting, and research activities such as performing month end accruals and reconciliations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Validates daily Ethanol and Feed Products loaded and daily Corn loads received.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares and submits daily validation reports.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Computes daily corn and product volumes for Daily Fleet Report.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs weekly review and identification of errors with coding of cost elements in purchase orders or invoices.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with review of purchase order\u002Fpurchase requisition data for accurate account or project assignments.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Plant Controller or Plant Accountant with monthly and quarterly compliance checklist.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with state and governmental audits and data gathering as needed, such as for state grain audits, state DOT reviews, FRA and TTB visits or audits.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes or assists with state and federal governmental reporting obligations<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Plant Accountant with FSMA compliance pertaining to co-product shipments, corn receipts and chemical receipts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes denaturant received and invoiced report.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists or reconciles chemical purchases and usage for the period.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes the actualization\u002Fsettlement process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes BDS loading and billing process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Researches and answers accounting questions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs or backs up Plant Accountant with audits of corn contracts and reviews commodities postings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews or assists with review vendor set up requests.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Advises Plant Controller of any non-compliance issues.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Office Coordinator or Administrative Assistant with phones or mail periodically.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Carries out other accounting-related duties or special projects as requested by the Plant Controller, VP Accounting, or other members of the Management Team.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>This position is salaried nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Associates degree or bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related technical degree is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Three years of clerical accounting experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Accounting experience in a manufacturing or grains handling environment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience using Microsoft Office programs (i.e. Outlook, Word, and Excel) required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Aurora<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Aurora ethanol plant is located near Aurora, South Dakota, six miles east of Brookings and 60 miles north of Sioux Falls. The bio-refinery sits on 420 acres and started ethanol production in November 2003. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. Recognized as the ethanol industry's first 100 million-gallon-per-year production facility, the Aurora plant now annually processes approximately 49 million bushels of corn into approximately 140 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 368,000 tons of distiller grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 65 employees.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Sr Reliability Engineer-22001MC\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Provides technical support to Maintenance, Operations, Turnaround and Capital Projects by providing assistance in resolving fixed equipment design, operation, and maintenance problems, as well as developing pressure vessel and piping mechanical specifications, repair plans and Fitness for Service evaluations.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Procures fixed equipment identified as required for reliability improvements for both routine maintenance and turnarounds<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides technical support to Turnaround and Capital Project groups on fixed equipment design, installations and repairs to ensure that equipment reliability, operability, and maintainability are addressed<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides estimates and develops justifications for reliability improvement and equipment replacements\u002Fupgrades during project development<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides technical support to the inspection department with day-to-day activities with respect to field findings from both planned and unplanned events<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and reviews site Maintenance Standard Practices and Inspection Manuals as needed<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs Fitness for Services evaluations and remaining life calculations on fixed equipment following applicable codes and standards<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides quality control\u002Fassurance services for shop and field repairs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Leads and supports Root Cause Failure Analysis<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Generates Management of Change (eMOC)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains unit records, tabulations and drawings<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Utilizes reliability database, SAP and other electronic tools to track cost, equipment histories and preventive\u002Fpredictive maintenance<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides support in Special Emphasis Programs including RBI, DMR, MOE and others<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitors contractor activity for progress and quality on engineering and construction projects<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Consults with other departments on mechanical engineering problems<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Documents critical material and\u002For schedule decisions<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides project controls oversight on assigned projects for expenditures, schedule and scope attainment<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs all duties following the safety rules and guidelines established by the Refinery<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The salary range for this position is $117,600 to $161,700 and represents Valero’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of expected compensation at the time of this posting. Actual compensation will be determined based on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to, the individual’s qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Engineering required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Mechanical Engineering preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of engineering experience with fixed equipment required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in refining or petro-chemical industry preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>You may receive communication from Valero by email, telephone, or home mail regarding the status of your application for this position.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About the Benicia Refinery<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero acquired the Benicia Refinery in 2000. Built as a grass-roots project in 1968, this plant has undergone significant modifications and upgrades to become what it is today one of the most complex refineries in the United States. Approximately 70 percent of the refinery’s product slate is California Air Resources Board (CARB) gasoline, California’s clean-burning fuel. The refinery also has significant asphalt production capabilities and produces 35 percent of the asphalt supply in northern California. Currently, the refinery processes domestic crude from the San Joaquin Valley in California and the Alaska North Slope, along with foreign sour crudes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Accounting Coordinator-230010L\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Under general supervision, processes less complex accounts receivable, accounts payable, and related transactions in SAP according to established policies and procedures. Coordinates with external and internal customers to ensure all assigned transactions are recorded accurately and in a timely manner for cash collections, payment, and accounting close purposes.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Records journal entries, performs reconciliations, and makes adjustments and\u002For corrections as necessary.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates and works with internal customers, external customers and vendors to ensure proper recording\u002Fclassification of transactions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Processes feedstock sales and purchases for timely payment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Verifies accuracy of pricing and volumes to confirm compliance with customer and vendor contracts and deal sheet terms.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs month-end closing duties to ensure accurate financial reporting (e.g., review accounts receivable\u002Fpayable, month-end accruals and reporting).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with special projects for management or other operational areas as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>3 years of Accounting experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree - in Accounting preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Refinery or related experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates initiative and organizational ability to prioritize work to meet established department deadlines as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>High degree of accuracy, attention to detail and confidentiality preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work with others to accomplish challenging assignments preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, and other work-related documentation preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic understanding of general accounting principles, compliance requirements and ability to apply technical knowledge in execution of job duties preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic skill using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word and Excel) preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Broad knowledge and understanding of PC\u002Fcomputers, data processing, and programming relating to the accounting functions preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working knowledge of SAP preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. <div>\n  Sr Technical Trainer-22001SJ\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Effectively performs necessary work tasks to develop, maintain, and present materials for the purpose of training and educating all site employees. Develops and conducts programs to train employees in installation, operation, safety, maintenance, and repair of machinery and equipment. Designs and develops instructional material for computer-based training and other delivery platforms.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Plans and coordinates the different components of the site’s training function.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Partners with Operations, Maintenance, and Laboratory leadership to ensure all employee training, testing, and progression activities are completed on schedule.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates closely with HR regarding employee training \u002F certification completion that results in pay adjustment or job advancement.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates effectively with Front-line Supervisors to identify the most efficient time and place to schedule training activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and delivers training programs (Instructor Lead and Computer Based), including outlines, text, handouts, tests, and designing training exercises.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates training facilities and resources in advance of training activities such as training content; PowerPoint presentation; training aids; and classroom setup.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proctors knowledge-based tests and assists subject-matter expert \u002F trainer with performance-based testing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Verifies that training activity documentation is complete and properly retained.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs internal reviews, surveys and \u002F or interviews with attendees to evaluate training course effectiveness.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Observes trainees during classroom exercises and answers questions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates thorough knowledge of responsible complex units, crafts, equipment in the field, and \u002F or other specialized areas, as directed by the Technical Training Supervisor \u002F Superintendent.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates implementation and execution of Corporate Training initiatives, such as the Basic Operator Training program.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates the Qualification \u002F Refresher Operations Training program.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Mentors and trains Basic Operator Trainees.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides test remediation and reassessment support for all job required training.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviews and updates training materials and tests as appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Schedules, proctors and reviews all Operations assessment \u002F test activities.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops training schedules (periodic and annual).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in Corporate Health, Safety, PSM and Environmental audits to verify that site training is properly documented and meets or exceeds organizational requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>LI-LP1<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>3 years of training development experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Psychology, or related area preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Process operations experience in a refinery environment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintenance\u002FIndustrial experience in a refinery environment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, and other work-related documentation preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results, and communications preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficient skill using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., PowerPoint and Excel) required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to analyze problems\u002Ftroubleshooting &amp; problem solving: Systematically determine the root cause(s) of problems through questioning and inspecting, and then identify the best course of action to take in relation to learning and development preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero.
