<div>\n  SAP Application Developer-220011Q\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want to go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the people in the communities where we live and work.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As an <b>SAP Application Developer<\u002Fb> you will design, develop, extend, test and implement business applications that support strategic initiatives, create efficiencies and deliver value for Valero across a variety of functional disciplines supporting our Commercial, Refining and Financial &amp; Admin Systems departments. Working in close collaboration with end-users and your teammates across our IS departments, you will have significant influence on application design and architecture while creating valuable solutions leveraging your SAP technical expertise and specific knowledge in these functional process areas:<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Commercial Systems<\u002Fb> focuses on Valero's Marketing, Supply and Transportation business enabling Hydrocarbon Supply Chain Management processes including Supply and Demand Planning, Procure-To-Pay, Order-To-Cash, Hydrocarbon Inventory Management, Logistics and Transportation.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Refining Systems<\u002Fb> focuses on Valero's Refining, Renewable Diesel, Ethanol and Logistics operations enabling our Maintenance, Reliability, Turnaround, Operations Excellence, Strategic Sourcing and Environmental, Health &amp; Safety processes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Financial &amp; Admin Systems<\u002Fb> focuses on Valero's Financial &amp; Administration operations enabling our Accounting, Financial, Treasury, Tax, Legal, Human Resources, Portfolio and Project Management, Business Process Controls and Records Management processes.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As a Developer on the Application Development Services team, you are a member of a select team that has the ability to make an impact within many of the different departments within Valero.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Key Competencies:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Problem Solving<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiative<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Results Orientation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpersonal Skills<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Demonstrate passion for continuous improvement and accountability<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Transform business requirements for large scale systems into technical solutions<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Partner with developers, business analysts and end-users to deliver efficient solutions<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrate strong programming and analytical skills with a creative, user-focused mindset<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Plan and execute complex development efforts to deliver great quality on schedule<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Be organized and communicate effectively through written and verbal methods<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> Minimum Requirements<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li><b>A bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent, required.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of object-oriented development using either SAP ABAP Objects, Java or C# required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of working with relational databases, SQL scripting and data modeling required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience working with at least one of the following SAP functional modules groupings required: \n    <ul>\n     <li>SD, MM, TSW<\u002Fli> \n     <li>PM, MM, EAM, MOC, ORM, EHSM, MDG<\u002Fli> \n     <li>FI, CO, PRA, GRC, GTS, BPC, PPM, HR<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>Preferred Requirements<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Oil and gas industry experience.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with any of the following: \n    <ul>\n     <li>S\u002F4HANA, Core Data Services (CDS), OData services using the Netweaver Gateway, ABAP-Managed Database Procedures (AMDP)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>SAP UI5, Fiori, CSS, HTML5, Javascript<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Business Objects Processing Framework (BOPF)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Business Rule Framework plus (BRFplus)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Integration Platform and tools – SAP Process Integration (PI\u002FPO), webMethods, SAP ALE, SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI)<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>The above description reflects the primary job function and may not include all detailed job functions performed in the role.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Benefits:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding? Take a look at some of our best-in-class benefits:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Competitive Pay and Annual Bonus Program<\u002Fli> \n   <li>100% match on 401(K) up to 7%, with immediate vesting<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Company-sponsored Pension Plan<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Comprehensive Healthcare and Wellness Programs<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Daycare Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Employee &amp; Family Wellness Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>State-of-the-art 24-hour Fitness Center free for employees and spouses with access to Tennis and Basketball Facilities<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite cafeteria open for breakfast and lunch<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Beautiful wooded campus with walking paths and access to biking\u002Fhiking on the greenbelt<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. <div>\n  Associate Accounting Coordinator - Accounts Payable-22001S8\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Evaluates, analyzes and records non-trade and employee activity to ensure proper financial reporting of income, expense and accrual information. Coordinates with internal and external customers to provide financial and account analysis for research and planning purposes.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Analyzes and records non trade transactions in SAP.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates with corporate and field personnel to ensure proper recording\u002Fclassification of transactions in the financial statements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Processes approved cost items for timely payment. Monitors status of open items and optimizes prompt payment discounts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Establishes and maintains regular communication with vendors.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reconciles vendor statements to Valero’s financial statements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists or prepares accrual information for monthly accounting cycle.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Researches and reconciles assigned non-trade GL accounts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with the day-to-day accounting activities, which may include analyzing a variety of transactions, compiling data and providing a resolution to management and\u002For other internal\u002Fexternal customers.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in various projects to improve overall department efficiency and effectiveness.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>High school diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Accounting preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>1 year of Accounting experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Refinery or related experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to demonstrate initiative and ability to meet established department deadlines preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Attention to detail, accuracy and confidentiality preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Effective verbal, listening and written communication skills preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work with others to accomplish assignments preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, and other work-related documentation preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic understanding of general accounting principles and ability to apply in execution of job duties preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic skill using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word and Excel) preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Broad knowledge and understanding of PC\u002Fcomputers, data processing, and programming relating to the accounting functions preferred preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working knowledge of SAP preferred preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Work-Study Program, Lab Technician – Ethanol Plant-230010P\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Reporting to the QA\u002FQC Manager and mentor, the Work-Study QA\u002FQC Lab Tech student will be exposed to the quality assurance\u002Fquality control (QA\u002FQC) program for the ethanol plant to ensure maximum production quantity and quality. This is an on-going Work-Study position and will possibly continue until students' graduation date.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n    It is the intent of the Work-Study program to provide a valuable and beneficial learning experience.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Assists in carrying out the plant QA\u002FQC program.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Draws and processes samples at various points in the process, conducting QA\u002FQC tests as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Helps to monitor use and inventories of laboratory chemicals and supplies.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares reports and analyzes data within the process of the facility.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains safety, health and environmental policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in the safety program for the QA\u002FQC laboratory.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists to coordinates activities with other departments.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates directly with QA\u002FQC Manager to ensure effective participation by the process operators in the implementation of QA\u002FQC policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates to implement programs and procedures required to ensure laboratory and plant cleanliness.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status, which means you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>\n    <div>\n     High school diploma or GED required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Currently pursuing an Associate’s degree (or higher) from an accredited college, university, or junior college in a science, agriculture, technology, or mathematics field or accepted into an Associate’s degree (or higher) program in a science, agriculture, technology, or mathematics field required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>On-going work study students are required to work 20-25 hours per week during the semester and 40 hours per week during the summer.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reside within commuting distance to the ethanol plant for the entire duration of the on-going work-study required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>2.5 GPA or above preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with laboratory equipment found in an academic environment is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Mount Vernon<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Mount Vernon ethanol plant is located in Mount Vernon, Indiana, in the far southwestern corner of the state on the Ohio River, the boundary with Kentucky. Part of the Evansville, Indiana, metropolitan area, Mount Vernon is approximately 190 miles southwest of Indianapolis. The bio-refinery sits on 112 acres leased from the Ports of Indiana, and started ethanol production in December 2010. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Mount Vernon plant processes approximately 35 million bushels of corn into approximately 100 million gallons of ethanol and 2630,000 tons of distillers grains per year. The plant employs approximately 60 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  SAP S\u002F4HANA Developer-220011P\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want to go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the people in the communities where we live and work.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As an <b>SAP S\u002F4HANA Developer<\u002Fb> you will be part of a project team that delivers high quality, low maintenance software solutions that are fast and efficient to achieve defined business goals. You will have significant influence on application design and architecture while creating custom applications that support strategic initiatives and build value for Valero. Working in close collaboration with end-users, and your teammates throughout our IS departments, you will develop system functionality using S\u002F4HANA technologies and Fiori design principles to enable and empower business objectives.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As a Developer on the Application Development Services team, you are a member of a select team that has the ability to make an impact within many of the different departments within Valero.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Key Competencies:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Problem Solving<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiative<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Results Orientation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpersonal Skills<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Demonstrate passion for continuous improvement and accountability<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Transform business requirements for large scale systems into technical solutions<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Partner with developers, business analysts and end-users to deliver efficient solutions<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrate strong programming and analytical skills with a creative, user-focused mindset<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Plan and execute complex development efforts to deliver great quality on schedule<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Be organized and communicate effectively through written and verbal methods<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> Minimum Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent, required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of object-oriented development using either SAP ABAP Objects, Java or C# required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of working with relational databases, SQL scripting and data modeling required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years S\u002F4HANA technologies such as Core Data Services (CDS) and OData services using the NetWeaver Gateway required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years experience with enterprise web application design and development utilizing SAP UI5 with Fiori design guidelines required<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>Preferred Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Oil and gas industry experience.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years experience with any of the following- \n    <ul>\n     <li>WebDynpro\u002FFPM technologies.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>ABAP- Managed Database Procedures (AMDP)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>CSS, HTML5 and Javascript<\u002Fli> \n     <li>SAP functional modules – SD (TSW), MM, FI, PM, <div>\n  VMware &amp; Microsoft System Engineering Specialist-22001PW\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the lives of the people in the communities that we live and work.<br> <br> As a <b>VMware and Microsoft System Engineering Specialist<\u002Fb>, you will be responsible for the technical operation of Information Services (I\u002FS) infrastructure, primarily focused on operating systems, virtualization, collaboration, and server hardware.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders. You can help achieve this goal if you can:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operate and maintain Valero’s internal Microsoft Windows server environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operate and maintain Valero’s internal VMware VSphere environment<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Contribute to Valero’s automation initiatives using PowerShell.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follow ITIL based service management processes (Change, Incident, Request)<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Successful candidates will have (requirements):<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>At least 5 years of experience operating and maintaining Microsoft Windows servers in a large enterprise environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>High school diploma or GED.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>The most competitive candidates will have (preferences):<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A bachelor's degree (or higher) in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with VMware VSphere, Microsoft SCCM, Microsoft Exchange, or Microsoft Skype for Business in a large enterprise.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with infrastructure automation using PowerShell or python.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>I\u002FS infrastructure operations experience in a large enterprise.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience operating and maintaining a variety of complex I\u002FS systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>The above description reflects the primary job function and may not include all detailed job functions performed in the role.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding? It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. <div>\n  Mechanic II (Combo Metals II)-2300107\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Assumes responsibility for plant mechanical and piping installations, mechanical equipment maintenance, line blinding, bolting and piping equipment removal, torquing, and hydro testing.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Fabricates and installs process pipe, structural steel and related equipment per plant code requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs maintenance on piping systems, heat exchangers, process vessels and other plant process equipment, utilizing any combination of boiler making and pipefitting.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs line blinding of refinery piping and equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Removes and installs repaired equipment, especially strainers, filters, vessels, and other process equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works on and demonstrates knowledge of all types of valves – block valves, control valves, PSV’s, etc. - including preventive maintenance, packing, and repair.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs exchanger breakdown, repair and testing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs repairs to process heaters and other fired equipment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs basic structural steel installation and repair.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Trains and becomes certified to operate various types of heavy equipment (forklifts, cherry-pickers, man lifts, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs basic rigging tasks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reads and interprets pipe specs, isometric drawings, instructions, repair manuals, correspondence and memos.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates good problem solving abilities related to operating and mechanical situations within the process area.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Effectively communicates in written and verbal format.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works daily in various computer systems, including work order systems, email, and training programs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures self, personnel and equipment are working in a safe manner by following procedures and guidelines.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Installs and maintains process pipe and piping systems within the refinery.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Selects, installs, and removes various pipe, and piping systems, fittings, gaskets, tubing, and valves.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uses hand and power tools to complete assigned work tasks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Uses precision measuring and alignment tools to ensure proper alignment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrates the ability to read and interpret basic schematics, blueprints, and drawings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Follows guidelines and procedures to ensure that equipment is working in a safe and reliable manner.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is hourly nonexempt status which means that you are eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High school diploma or General Education Degree (GED) required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Valid driver's license required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum two years’ experience applying boilermaking, pipefitting and\u002For welding skills in a petrochemical or refinery environment or a degree in a related field required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience reading and interpreting engineering drawings required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Pipe welding skills preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Rigging skills and experience with powered lifting and\u002For materials handling equipment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work call-outs and unscheduled overtime which includes nights, weekends and holidays required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. <div>\n  Electrical Engineer-22001M5\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Provides support in the total planning and execution of refinery electrical capital and maintenance projects, provides electrical assistance to Maintenance Department and Operations Departments, and develops Electrical System Reliability programs and procedures that ensure the Refinery is operating at maximum efficiency and reliability. Provides additional departmental support by cross-training in instrumentation duties to ensure efficient coverage, as needed.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provides technical assistance to the refinery on routine daily electrical issues, including providing troubleshooting assistance to the Electricians, making recommendations to the refinery on field repairs, interpretation of Electrical data gathered during Preventative Maintenance Work orders, and consultations with Design Engineering on electrical design packages.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Operations and Maintenance Departments during Electrical System Disturbances.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Creates and updates electrical drawings such as one-line diagrams, motor schematics, panel schedules, and other related drawings as needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares and submit Management of Change (MOC) documentation related to electrical systems and projects and champion the change process through to Pre-Startup Safety Review, Startup of the change and Closeout of the MOC.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and stewards electrical system reliability improvement opportunities, including participation in development and execution of a strategy to improve plant electrical reliability. This strategy involves capital improvement, preventive maintenance, repair strategies, etc<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Updates and maintains SKM electrical system model as electrical system additions and changes occur.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prepares high voltage switching procedures. Coordinate and oversee the execution of these procedures by Operations or Maintenance personnel.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proposes amendments to Electrical Safety Policy as necessary to address latest codes and technology.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides functional and final checkouts of new and modified Electrical System Installations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in incident investigations and assists in generating incident reports or failure analyses for incidents involving electrical system disturbances and electrical equipment failures.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s or higher level degree in Electrical Engineering is required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>2 years of electrical engineering experience in an industrial plant required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in refining or petrochemical environment preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with electrical distribution systems, large project execution both engineering and field construction, protective relay coordination, application and testing, and hazardous area classifications preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with induction and synchronous motors and distribution transformers preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>2 or more years of engineering experience in all phases of instrument\u002Felectrical systems design and installation preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  Business Intelligence Support Specialist-22001GA\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want to go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the people in the communities where we live and work.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As a <b>Business Intelligence Support Specialist<\u002Fb>, you will provide support for Valero’s business intelligence tools and systems. You will foster relationships with business users to ensure their information needs are being met and provide timely resolution to their issues. You will help design, implement and support enterprise reporting solutions to our core business units. This role primarily uses SAP HANA, BW and Business Objects to support business intelligence needs of the business by working in close collaboration with other teams, end-users, and other IS departments to meet the company’s goals.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Key Competencies<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Problem Solving<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiative<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Results Orientation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpersonal Skills<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Responsibilities:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Thrive in a close-knit culture that values teamwork and collaboration.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Enjoy working independently and taking on new challenges.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Be motivated and enjoy making positive impacts as a part of a collaborative team.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Embrace continuous growth and learning new technologies and techniques as the environment evolves.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proactively seek out opportunities to get involved and add value.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Build strong relationship across IS and business teams.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bring an attention to detail with strong problem-solving skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provide top quality customer service.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Stay organized and multi-task effectively.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicate effectively through oral and written methods.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> Minimum Requirements required:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5+ years of technical experience utilizing SAP BW and\u002For SAP HANA.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with Analysis for Office (AO) or other Reporting Tools.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understanding of SAP BusinessObjects and Microsoft Power BI development, configuration and performance tuning.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>Preferred Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  Systems Engineering Specialist - Active Directory-22001PF\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want to go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the people in the communities where we live and work.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As a <b>Systems Engineering Specialist - Active Directory<\u002Fb>, under the direction of the Data Security Team Lead, you will function as a member of the Data Security Team to assist in the design, implementation and maintenance of appropriate data security for a wide variety of applications. The primary focus of this position is to design, implement, monitor, and maintain access control for AD related systems, identity management, and security application support. Plans, coordinates, tests researches, and implements security measures to safeguard information in computer files against accidental or unauthorized access, modification, destruction, or disclosure. Works closely with team members, end users and other IS departments to meet the company's goals and ensure the protection, confidentiality and integrity of the overall information architecture for the organization.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Key Competencies<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Problem Solving<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiative<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Results Orientation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpersonal Skills<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Responsibilities:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provides Microsoft Active Directory (AD) and Microsoft Identity Management (MIM) support for a large, multi-domain, dispersed corporate environment (1,000+ servers, multiple time zones, 20,000+ users, 10,000+ computers).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides domain controller hardware and software support, monitoring, AD security delegation, replication, troubleshooting, disaster recovery, domain migrations, and DNS support.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports ADFS functions and file share security management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collaborates on critical IT projects to ensure that security issues are addressed throughout the project life cycle.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures security KPIs are within acceptable level by monitoring and addressing potential issues. Generate security reports and update management as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in periodic compliance reviews and security assessments. Works with auditors, legal representatives for investigating possible security violations. Continuously monitors the status and effectiveness of security controls.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides on-call support in the areas of Windows server support and management, server patch management, and support for third party add-ins from vendors such as Quest, Specops, and Centrify.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works on or assists with basic tasks in the design, configuration, development, implementation, maintenance and monitoring of the enterprise-wide IT security infrastructure. This includes, but is not limited to: trouble-shooting, problem-solving, issue resolution, user interaction, training, defining systems scope, gathering requirements, documenting functional and design specifications, research and fact-finding, testing, reporting, cutover, IS and business user coordination. Performs control and vulnerability assessments and participates in compliance reviews.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Willing to learn the security concepts of SAP User &amp; Role Management and train to provide secondary support in SAP Security in multiple landscapes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>May be required to work off-hours and on weekends for projects and\u002For support.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Some travel may be required.\\<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Minimum Requirements:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>5 years of relevant information services experience in direct computing support activities including thorough knowledge of equipment, application, software, networking, and operating system software.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience administering Active Directory 2016, including design, configuration, and support.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with Active Directory 2016 group policies, scripting languages, Microsoft MIM, SQL databases preferred, domain migrations, domain controllers, server operation system &amp; related hardware.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge of ADFS Functions &amp; file share security management using Active Directory Groups.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Preferred Requirements:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Refinery industry or related business\u002FIT knowledge with SAP system experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working experience with Microsoft Identity Management (MIM) &amp; Azure AD Management concepts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with GRC products, IDM, SAP Ecatt and ABAP preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with Security Design and Implementation in SAP R\u002F3, BW, HR, XI, CRM, and S\u002F4 HANA.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Sound knowledge of the SAP Security concepts, landscapes, and transport systems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understanding of business processes, controls frameworks, compliances and regulations, and segregation of duty concepts in an SAP ERP environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Microsoft and ITIL certifications preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Benefits<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding? Take a look at some of our best-in-class benefits:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Competitive Pay and Annual Bonus Program<\u002Fli> \n   <li>100% match on 401(K) up to 7%, with immediate vesting<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Company-sponsored Pension Plan<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Comprehensive Healthcare and Wellness Programs<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Daycare Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Employee &amp; Family Wellness Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>State-of-the-art 24-hour Fitness Center free for employees and spouses with access to Tennis and Basketball Facilities<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite cafeteria open for breakfast and lunch<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Sprawling campus with walking paths and access to biking\u002Fhiking on the greenbelt<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>The above description reflects the primary job function and may not include all detailed job functions performed in the role.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n process and procedures to maintain compliance with all applicable local, state and federal regulations and permits under OSHA, TTB, FRA, EPA and state environmental agencies.<\u002Fli> \n <li>Maintains facility’s commitments under the sites Air, Appropriations, NPDES, and Waste permits. Completes multi-media responsibility for task driven commitments.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Establishes and maintains relationship with local fire departments and response organizations to facilitate their participation in the Facility Response Plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains and ensures implementation of Process Safety Management (PSM).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures implementation of Safe Work Practices (SWP), including providing training and making required changes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Implements site security plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures Fugitive VOC emissions compliance. Maintains LeakDAS inventory and conducts monitoring as necessary.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with other departments to ensure completion of Title V compliance tasks (inspections, logs, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Implements tasks defined on Environmental Health and Safety Routine Duties Calendar, ensuring 100% compliance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains Environmental Health &amp; Safety policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains Chemical Management System, including driving change as necessary and accountability for budget and relationship management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains compliance data systems, providing clear, timely access to information for routine reporting.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides support to the site’s Safety Committee Chairperson and team as well as the Hazard Recognition Inspection Team (HRIT).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains Environmental Health &amp; Safety policies and procedures by reviewing and making changes as necessary, in conjunction with HSE Manager.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains chemical management system including safety data sheets and chemical approval process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains site portable gas meters and conducts monthly calibrations, repair as necessary. Tracks calibrations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures Industrial Hygiene testing is conducted. Coordinates sampling and training with contractor.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures systems are in place to provide required compliance and site’s performance for all areas of responsibility.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops training schedule and provides self-performed training.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains HSE training calendar.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains all required materials and any vendor contracts for EH&amp;S training.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinates Confined Space Rescue training.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducts new hire and refresher safety training, per the VRF training matrix, and ensures documentation of records.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures training is conducted according to the EAP\u002FFRP, SPCC and RMP<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducts new hire and refresher safety training, per the VRF training matrix, and ensures documentation of records.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains (Powered Industrial Trucks (PIP) training program. Coordinates with outside contractor.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures all required compliance and performance audits are performed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes tasks required for regular audits of permits, regulations and plant performance criteria.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducts inspections as required per SPCC, FRP, and EAP.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicates any compliance issues found during audits and walkthroughs and communicates to appropriate persons.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures inspections of plant equipment is completed and documented (fall protections, slings, ladders, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participates in incident investigations as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Tracks leading and lagging indicators for environmental health and safety and health performance<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b>Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>High School diploma or GED required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum three years of experience in operating industrial facility subject to environmental, health and safety regulations required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree (or higher degree) in Engineering, Safety\u002FEnvironmental Sciences or related technical field preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in the area of industry, energy or manufacturing preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Valero’s pre-employment process includes successful completion of a background check and pre-employment drug screen.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>About Valero Renewables – Albion<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's Albion ethanol plant is located near Albion, Nebraska, about 50 miles southwest of Norfolk. The bio-refinery sits on 107 acres and started ethanol production in October 2007. The facility uses a dry-grind production method and state-of-the-art technology to maintain industry-leading standards in production, safety, product quality and environmental stewardship. The Albion plant annually processes approximately 47 million bushels of corn into approximately 135 million gallons of denatured ethanol and 355,000 tons of distillers grains co-products. The bio-refinery employs approximately 60 employees.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. <div>\n  Database Administration Specialist - Oracle-22001KJ\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want go around the globe. Our employees work together as a team with the primary goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer in the marketplace. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the lives of the people in the communities that we work and live in.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As a <b>Database Administration Specialist - Oracle<\u002Fb> on the DBA team, you will be responsible for building and operating the database infrastructure used by all business applications. The primary focus will be with Oracle, SQL Server and SAP HANA database platforms - working closely with functional teams, as well as other I\u002FS teams, on major developments and support issues.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Key Competencies:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Problem Solving<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiative<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Results Orientation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpersonal Skills<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Orientation to Details<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Responsibilities:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Technical skills in Oracle and SQL Server to include database administration tasks such as maintenance and tuning, database architecture, concepts, and routine DBA maintenance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Installs, configures, upgrades, patches, and operates Valero’s databases to maintain availability, optimal performance, and compliance with Valero standards.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proactively identifies and assesses any issues, performs troubleshooting, researches solutions focusing on root cause.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works hands-on as a team member covering all facets of database administration from installation to query and database tuning, as well as standards development, documentation, and working with other technical staff to ensure the database environment is robust and meets the customer’s needs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures the proper use of indexes and other database objects to enable desired functionality.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Partners with developers to build expertise in tuning tools to ensure we are achieving acceptable performance level statistics.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works with infrastructure teams to ensure database and operating system monitoring are providing a complete readiness view.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs analysis on and recommends quality complex solutions to information system infrastructure technology disciplines\u002Fcomponents.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides continuous inputs in maintaining software development processes and standards.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Occasionally leads projects or tasks.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works independently and efficiently with minimal supervision. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>May be required to work off-hours and on weekends for projects and\u002For support.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Some travel may be required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> Minimum Requirements (required):<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of DBA experience with Oracle 12c or higher or SQL Server 2016 or higher.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with tuning PL\u002FSQL or T-SQL in order to advise developers and be very comfortable with multiple operating systems (Windows 2016\u002F2019 and Linux).<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>Preferred Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Experience with Oracle Enterprise Manager \u002F Cloud Control.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Windows PowerShell scripting.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting Services (SSRS), and Policy Management.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with SAP HANA.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Benefits:<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding?<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Take a look at some of our best-in-class benefits:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Competitive Pay and Annual Bonus Program<\u002Fli> \n   <li>100% match on 401(K) up to 7%, with immediate vesting<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Company-sponsored Pension Plan<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Comprehensive Healthcare and Wellness Programs<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Daycare Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Employee &amp; Family Wellness Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>State-of-the-art 24-hour Fitness Center free for employees and spouses with access to Tennis and Basketball Facilities<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite cafeteria open for breakfast and lunch<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A sprawling campus with walking paths and access to biking\u002Fhiking on the greenbelt.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<br> <br> Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. <div>\n  Commercial &amp; Refinery Optimization Planning Engineer-DP-22001NB\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Responsible for feedstock and production optimization at DGD. The position develops, maintains, and publishes run-out schedules in order to manage tankage limitations, refinery operating requirements, third party terminal and Marketing requirements. Involvement in a variety of adhoc commercial feedstock optimization and product disposition projects. The position will have regular collaboration with fuels compliance and accounting functions. Works with the Operations group to ensure optimal refinery operating signals and plans are understood. Monitors, maintains and communicates to all affected parties the key operating signals, operating constraints and their cost, and any significant deviations from the operating plan or current target.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Issues monthly Refinery Operating Plan and communicate the plans with Corporate Planning &amp; Economics (P&amp;E) group as well as refinery operations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops the refinery’s Strategic Plan annually.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs a quarterly back cast on refinery operations and issue a formal report with recommendations identified from this process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Utilizes LP model to generate weekly economic margins and publishes the results in the weekly Operating Plan which directs unit operations to maximize refinery profitability.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Identifies opportunities to improve the refinery optimization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Generates ECOMP analysis on all proposed refinery signal changes. (These will be approved by Corporate P&amp;E before implementation)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Publishes weekly income forecast and associated price\u002Fvolume variance analysis. Issues the detailed price\u002Fvolume variance analysis at the end of each month.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Updates weekly activity report for the refinery Planning and Economics group.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develops and maintains a list of daily optimizations and synergies which enhance the refinery.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Works in collaboration with the Corporate Regional Optimization Engineers to optimize synergistic effects between refineries.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides timely and cost effective guidance and technical service to Operations for plan variances 24 hrs \u002F day.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provides vacation relief for the Optimization Manager and the Crude\u002FFeedstock Scheduler.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Engineering required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Chemical Engineering preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum two years of refining industry engineering experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Prior refinery economic experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong understanding of refinery operations and the impact of feedstock quality on production rates and product quality required. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to read and interpret company policies, regulatory guidelines, and other work-related documentation required. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results, and communications required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Skill in providing thorough, efficient, and effective customer service to individuals at all levels within the organization required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to communicate effectively through written and verbal methods required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to accomplish work within required timelines, including short, long, and emergency timeframes required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to cross-train in other department duties to ensure efficient coverage department responsibilities required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to work with others to accomplish challenging assignments required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple assignments to ensure completion of tasks within stated time requirements is required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic skill using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word and Excel) required.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>All successful candidates must be eligible to obtain a TWIC card (Transportation Worker Identification Credential). It is Valero’s policy that employees must wear this card at all times while working at the refinery. Please review eligibility criteria at <b>https:\u002F\u002Fwww.tsa.gov\u002Ffor-industry\u002Ftwic<\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Valero is an EEO\u002FAA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, including race\u002Fethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on a website that lists an estimated salary rate\u002Frange, it was not provided by Valero. Valero’s market specific salary rate\u002Frange will be provided during the recruiting process and tends to be higher than what is estimated by such websites.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n <div>\n  IT Systems Design Specialist - Refining Systems-22001E5\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero is the best-in-class producer of essential fuels and products that are foundational to modern life. The world requires reliable, affordable and sustainable energy and we see this as an opportunity. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team to relentlessly pursue excellence, embrace the highest standards of safety and responsible operations, leverage our creativity and technical expertise to solve challenging problems, care about our employees and the communities where we work and live, and recognize integrity is critical to our ongoing success. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a <b>Business Systems Specialist<\u002Fb> in the Refining Systems team of Valero’s IT division, you will be part of a team that provides digital business solutions for our Refining, Logistics, and Green Diesel operations. This includes an ecosystem of integrated software solutions, mobile devices, and proprietary applications – both on-premise and in the cloud. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Your role will focus on the Implementation and support of Engineering &amp; Process Analytics, Product Quality, Operations, Environmental, Health and Safety Systems used across all business units.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>At Valero, we are committed to advancing the future of energy through innovation, ingenuity and unmatched execution while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Key Competencies required for this position are:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Problem Solving<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiative<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Results Orientation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpersonal Skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Responsibilities:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Analyze and quickly master solutions for digitally-enabled business processes<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support and improve applications implemented at various Valero locations<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participate in all phases of the application development lifecycle (e.g. planning, analysis, design, development, cutover, and support)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Be organized and communicate effectively through written and verbal methods<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collaborate across the organization and with outside parties<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provide outstanding customer service and keep related commitments for assigned tasks<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Minimum Requirements (Require):<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or related field or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of experience in IT system implementation, reporting and\u002For application support<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with Relational Databases, SQL &amp; Reporting, Enterprise Business systems<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Preferred Requirements:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Refinery industry or related business process\u002FIT knowledge<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience working in an IT project or support role<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with troubleshooting and debugging systems<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with software design, testing, and change management processes<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience working with vendors, IT, and business teams located remotely<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with analytics and reporting tools such as: Microsoft SSRS, Power BI, SQL Server, or other related system<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with Relational Databases like MS SQL Server and\u002For Oracle<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with Programming Languages like JavaScript, HTML, Python, C#, SQL<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience using or configuring SAP systems<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>The above description reflects the primary job function and may not include all detailed job functions performed in the role. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Benefits:<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding? <div>\n  Financial Planning &amp; Analysis Analyst-22001R1\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Assists with maintaining and enhancing FP&amp;A systems, provides support for the monthly plan, earnings forecasts and annual budget process, and performs basic ad hoc analysis for management under direct supervision.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Assists with maintaining on-going integrity of all FP&amp;A systems, databases, and reporting tools. Addresses system risks and incorporates efficiencies to improve accuracy and timeliness of budget and forecast reporting.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Creates, designs, and maintains basic to moderate ad-hoc reports from enterprise financial systems or databases such as Business Warehouse and SAP.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with the annual budget process by creating annual budget guidelines, developing and presenting end user budget training, and gathering and analyzing budget data.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interacts with individuals across the organization to field questions and provide support during the annual budget process.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with presentations for management, including earnings forecast updates, Board presentations, and annual budget presentations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with variance analysis for management to explain changes in key cost drivers for budget vs. actual, budget vs. forecast, forecast vs. forecast, and forecast vs. actual results.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists with special projects and ad hoc financial analysis for management that is low to moderate complexity, including “what-if” scenarios and trend analysis for key cost drivers.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul> \n   <li>Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Accounting Information Systems required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum of three years of accounting, equivalent public accounting, and\u002For accounting systems experience required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Accounting systems experience preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in refining industry preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>CPA or CPA candidate preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to create and design standard queries or reports from financial databases such as SAP, BW, and Analysis for Office preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Intermediate to advanced skill using Microsoft Office programs preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic understanding of generally accepted accounting principles, theories, and ability to apply them to the Corporation’s accounting needs preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to apply critical thinking skills to analyze problems and solve issues preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to abide by confidentiality requirements when working with sensitive information, results, and communications preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple assignments to ensure completion of tasks within stated time requirements preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to communicate effectively through written and verbal methods with individuals at all levels across the organization preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<br> <br> Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. <div>\n  IT Systems Specialist: SAP SD and MM - Commercial-22001GE\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Description<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><br> Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the lives of the people in the communities that we live and work.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>As a <b>Business Systems Specialist<\u002Fb> on the Information Services Commercial team, you will design and implement enterprise solutions around the hydrocarbon supply chain, including marketing, supply, trading, and transportation functions. The initial project the employee will join is in support of the Low Carbon Assurance Program. Valero is a leader within multiple low carbon fuel programs and you will contribute in building an enterprise carbon intensity tracking and trading optimization solution.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>The systems that you help implement will improve business processes, control costs and increase profitability. The primary focus will be on project work, but you will also be involved in supporting existing ERP, and other business related applications. This includes, but is not limited to: trouble-shooting, problem-solving, issue resolution, user interaction, training, defining systems scope, gathering requirements, documenting design, functional specifications &amp; test scripts, research and fact-finding, configuration, testing, reporting, cutover, IS and business user coordination.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Key Competencies:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Problem Solving<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Initiative<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Results Orientation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpersonal Skills<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Orientation to Details<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Responsabilities:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Perform analysis on complex business processes and recommend simplified, quality solutions to meet business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Deploy new solutions and enhancements\u002Ffixes to the Commercial business by troubleshooting, problem solving, interacting with end-users, training, defining system scope, configuration, testing, etc.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Be organized and manage business user interactions including requirements gathering, testing, training and post-implementation support.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Communicate effectively through written and verbal methods.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collaborate across the organization and with outside parties to deliver solutions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Meet milestones and related effort\u002Ftime commitments for assigned deliverables.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> Minimum Requirements (repquired):<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor's degree (or higher) in MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5 years of refinery industry or business\u002FIT experience utilizing SAP-Sales &amp; Distribution (SD) and\u002For SAP Materials Management (MM).<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>Preferred Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Experience with SAP’s IS-Oil module: Formula &amp; Average Pricing (F&amp;A), Hydrocarbon Product Management (HPM), Exchanges, Traders &amp; Schedulers Workbench (TSW).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Good understanding of the SD module integration with FI\u002FCO.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience debugging in SAP.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in OTC and\u002For P2P<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Benefits:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding? Take a look at some of our best-in-class benefits:<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Competitive Pay and Annual Bonus Program<\u002Fli> \n   <li>100% match on 401(K) up to 7%, with immediate vesting<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Company-sponsored Pension Plan<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Comprehensive Healthcare and Wellness Programs<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Daycare Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite Employee &amp; Family Wellness Center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>State-of-the-art 24-hour Fitness Center free for employees and spouses with access to Tennis and Basketball Facilities<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Onsite cafeteria open for breakfast and lunch<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Sprawling campus with walking paths and access to biking\u002Fhiking on the greenbelt<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p>Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team.
